* Understand the Business

  

This job description is not all inclusive. CareSource reserves the right to amend this job description at any time. CareSource is an Equal Opportunity Employer, including disability and veteran status. We are committed to a diverse and inclusive work environment.

title: Information Technology Administrator (Remote)
description:
**About Dew Wealth Management**

Dew Wealth Management is a Fiduciary Investment Advisory Firm that provides “Virtual Family Office” wealth management services to entrepreneurs through a model that is disrupting the investment advisory industry. Our visionary model and elite team of highly entrepreneurial advisors has resulted in an aggressive growth trajectory that Inc. Magazine has recognized as one of the fastest-growing privately held companies in the United States. We have also been lauded by Investment News as one of the “Best Places to Work for Financial Advisors,” and are a “Great Place to Work” certified company.

If you love being challenged by complex problems and are hungry for an opportunity to rapidly advance your skillset and career, Dew Wealth Management offers a collaborative and supportive culture that will invest in your professional development in equal measure to your investments in our clients’ success.

**About the Position**

If you’re looking for an opportunity to build out the nascent IT Department of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization, taking senior responsibility, not just for systems administration, but also for driving new initiatives designed to scale our IT infrastructure as this company grows from 34 employees to 100+ over the next few years, our IT Administrator (aka System Administrator) role may be for you.

Reporting directly to our , you will be the first full-time IT hire into this company, responsible for helping us reduce our independence on our outsourced IT vendor while also up-leveling (a) the technical support we can give our growing team of remote employees, and (b) the sophistication and scalability of our IT infrastructure. It’s an opportunity to play a pivotal role in building out the IT infrastructure of a rapidly growing company as it scales.

This is not an entry-level role. We’re looking for someone with significant experience in Office 365 network administration to come alongside us to up-level our IT architecture in a way that will help this company scale efficiently and securely. An ideal applicant would, therefore, have a degree in computer science, systems engineering, or network administration, as well as a Microsoft 365 Certification as a “Teams Administrator Associate” with an “Administrator Expert” certification being preferred. With that said, we understand that many of the most talented IT professionals took career paths that didn’t go through traditional educational institutions, nor have they prioritized chasing Microsoft certification to validate skills they have acquired through experience. So, if it’s possible for you to quickly get the aforementioned Microsoft Certifications, that would enhance your application. But we will give all applicants an opportunity to demonstrate their skills and experience throughout this process, even if they don’t check all the rigid academic and certification boxes that would be ideal.

**Working within a Distributed Workforce**

This is a fully remote role. Approximately four times per year, we will pay you to fly out to our headquarters in Scottsdale, AZ to get an opportunity to connect with your colleagues in person and align on quarterly objectives. Beyond that, however, your primary interaction with your colleagues will be through the cloud-based tech stack we leverage to align our distributed workforce, which includes employees across the United States.

Notwithstanding the virtual nature of our model, at present, we are only hiring applicants who reside within the continental United States (excluding CA) to minimize HR and tax complexities and to keep our team within four time zones of each other.

**Key Responsibilities**

Provide administrative and technical support for all IT assets within our diverse tech stack.

* Serve as the primary administrator of all assets within our diverse tech stack.
* Creating user accounts, performing access control, and assist colleagues with issues as they arise.
* Performing diagnostic tests and debugging procedures to optimize computer systems.
* Identify, diagnose, and resolve any technical issues that arise, ensuring minimal downtime and disruption to operations.
* Configure and enforce SSO policies accross our tech stack, as well as all related password policies and security best practices.

Manage and up-level our hybrid server architecture.

* Configure and manage all aspects of Office 365 users, from email and group setup, to teams and SharePoint administraton.
* Plan, test, and implement upgrades to the network infrastructure to improve performance and security.
* Manage the installation of servers, network devices, and firewalls to ensure a secure and efficient network environment.
* Continuously monitor the performance of all servers, software, and hardware to ensure they are operating efficiently and effectively.
* Coordinate the deployment of new applications, ensuring they are integrated smoothly and efficiently into the existing infrastructure.

Drive the creation of enterprise-grade IT systems architecture and management.

* Drive the buildout and implementation of new IT initiatives. (E.G. Transition of our DMS to SharePoint Online.)
* Maintain and update technical documentation related to system configurations, procedures, and troubleshooting steps.
* Work with Chief Operating Officer to put in place enterprise-grade security architecture and policies to comply with SEC expectations.

**Qualifications**

Required soft skills:

* Enthusiasm, high integrity, and a commitment to live out the organization’s 5 core values of transparency, collaboration, curiosity, visionariness, and hustle.
* Desire to grow intellectually and professionally as part of an Inc. 5000 rapidly-growing organization.
* Intellectually curious, with ability to help others navigate a tech stack designed to organize a distributed workforce.

Required Hard/Technical Skills & Abilities:

* Office 365 Administration
* SharePoint Online Administration
* Hybrid Network Administration, including familiarity with Active Directory administration and PowerShell scripting.

Education, Certification & Experience Requirements:

* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, systems engineering or network administration.
* Microsoft 365 Certification as a "Teams Administrator Associate" with an "Administrator Expert" certification being preferred.
* 3+ years of IT Administration experience within a professional services or tech firm at a minimum, 5+ years' experience preferred.

… or equivalent experience, and the ability to demonstrate the requisite level of technical skills the degrees and certifications above are designed to validate.

**Compensation**

Compensation for this role is $70,000 per year. Additionally, the firm offers a generous benefits package that includes, among other benefits, flexible PTO, fully subsidized healthcare, a 401(k)-matching program, and an Employee Stock Option Plan.

*Dew Wealth Management is an Equal Opportunity Employer. Please submit all inquiries to recruiting@dewwealth.com -- there is no guarantee that you will be followed up with properly except by applying through the external site provided.*

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $70,000.00 per year

Benefits:

* 401(k)
* Dental insurance
* Flexible schedule
* Health insurance
* Life insurance
* Paid time off
* Parental leave
* Referral program
* Retirement plan
* Vision insurance

Compensation package:

* Employee stock ownership plan

Experience level:

* 3 years

Schedule:

* 8 hour shift
* Monday to Friday

Work Location: Remote

title: Provider Network Specialist, Remote
description:
The Provider Network Specialist supports the development and management of the Network by managing scopes of work, providing technical assistance and monitoring provider contracts. This position acts as a liaison between the clinicians and the payor arrangements to enhance the business relationship. In addition, interacts with all areas of the organization to coordinate network management and network administration responsibilities. This role supports over 3,000 clinicians within the inpatient, acute and ambulatory care setting.

**Major Responsibilities:**

* Ensure accuracy of clinician-related demographic information changes and ensure completion of change requests for network management (e.g. Resignations, Leaves of Absence, Patient Membership Reassignment etc.)
* Complete and distribute roster requests to participating payors/service agreements on a recurring basis
* Receive, effectively respond to and resolve external payor related issues (incorrect demographics, clinicians showing out of network etc.)
* Assist in resolution of managed care membership concerns in partnership with clinician offices and ensures follow up to both the member and Payor.
* Participate in meetings with the payor account representatives documenting discussions, issues, action items, and route to the appropriate party for resolution (e.g. claims issues)
* Assists clinician offices in the interpretation and implementation of Managed Care payor policies and procedures for disenrollment of a member when appropriate ensuring proper documentation
* Educate clinician offices regarding policies and procedures related to network management, contract terms and other similar topics

 **Education/Experience Required:**

* Bachelors Degree in Healthcare, Business, Insurance or relevant field
* Typically requires 3 years of experience in Managed Care, Health Care Operations or Provider Relations.

 **Knowledge, Skills & Abilities Required:**

* Ability to independently problem solve
* Excellent verbal and written communication skills
* Strong organizational skills
* Able to navigate complexity/ambiguity
* Complete and manage to time-sensitive deadlines
* Excellent interpersonal skills and able to work with various stakeholders both Internal (e.g. Operations, Clinicians) and External (e.g. Payors)
* Experience with Microsoft Office Software (Work, Outlook, PowerPoint, Access etc.) and proficient with Microsoft Excel

**Physical Requirements and Working Conditions:**

* Exposed to normal office environment.
* Operates all equipment necessary to perform the job.

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Systems Administrator**  

  

**Who is Fusion Technology?**  

  

Fusion Technology is a performance-driven HUBZone Small Business concern residing in the heart of the beautiful mountainsides of West Virginia, steps away from the Federal Bureau of Investigation's Criminal Justice Information Services Division's Headquarters. Founded in 2007 by an Engineer-by-trade, Fusion Technology dedicates our valuable resources to providing comprehensive IT services and solutions to mission-critical US Government programs and the Intel Community.  

  

**Who are you?**  

* *Security-cleared Professional:* You have made it through the process of receiving a United States government security clearance – congratulations! We know you are a trustworthy intel professional because you have an active **Secret** security clearance.
* ***Experience is important to us:*** You have a Bachelor’s degree with:
	+ ***Junior level –*** 3+ years
	+ ***Mid-level –*** 7+ years
	+ ***Senior level –*** 10+ years

  

  

Position location: Remote (occasional travel to the main work site for special events)  

  

**What you’ll do:*** Responsible for the upkeep, configuration, and reliable operation of computer systems. System administrator will ensure the uptime, performance, resources, and security of the computers they manage meet the needs of the users. The systems administrator could be focused in one or more of the following areas:
* A database administrator (DBA) maintains a database system, and is responsible for the integrity of the data and the efficiency and performance of the system.
* A network administrator maintains network infrastructure such as switches and routers, and diagnoses problems with these or with the behavior of network-attached computers.
* A security administrator is a specialist in computer and network security, including the administration of security devices such as firewalls, as well as consulting on general security measures.
* A web administrator maintains web server services that allow for internal or external access to web sites. Tasks include managing multiple sites, administering security, and configuring necessary components and software. Responsibilities may also include software change management.
* A system programmer creates, modifies, and test the code, forms, and script that allow computer applications to run. They may also develop and write computer programs to store, locate, and retrieve specific documents, data, and information.
* A computer operator performs routine maintenance and upkeep, such as changing backup tapes or replacing failed drives.

  

  

**What matters to you matters to us.**  

  

Fusion Technology values its employees and works hard to ensure proper care for them and their families. We desire to compensate employees in a competitive, motivational, fair, and equitable way with other employers in the marketplace. Salary is only one component of employee compensation but an integral part of recruiting and retaining qualified employees. However, at Fusion Technology, we take a comprehensive approach and consider each employee's needs to tailor a compensation plan that provides financial security and peace of mind. Our competitive package includes a best-in-class matching 401K program, comprehensive Meritain healthcare plan, a competitive employer contribution to a health savings account, vision and dental plans, life insurance, short- and long-term disability, and personal leave, in addition to paid certifications and training.  

  

Fusion Technology LLC is an Equal Opportunity Employer. We respect and seek to empower each individual and support the diverse cultures, perspectives, skills, and experiences within our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to sex, race, ethnicity, age, national origin, citizenship, religion, physical or mental disability, medical condition, genetic information, pregnancy, family structure, marital status, ancestry, domestic partner status, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran or military status, or any other basis prohibited by law.

title: Wireless Administrator
description:
About DMI:

DMI is a leading global provider of digital services working at the intersection of public and private sectors. With broad capabilities across IT managed services, cybersecurity, cloud migration and application development, DMI provides on-site and remote support to clients within governments, healthcare, financial services, transportation, manufacturing, and other critical infrastructure sectors. DMI has grown to over 2,100+ employees globally and has been continually recognized as a Top Workplace in both regional and national categories.
About the Opportunity:

DMI, LLC is seeking a **Wireless Administrator** **Duties and** **Responsibilities:*** At least 5 years total network management experience operating, maintaining and updating a WLAN network to ensure they are kept up to date to ensure proper operations are maintained. This includes adding or deleting sites and or network devices, making configuration changes, upgrading Operating Systems, at a minimum.
* At least 5 years of engineering level network support that includes specific knowledge of:
	+ CISCO and/orAruba wireless infrastructure. Skills and experience in both is a big plus.
	+ Access point/authentication, and device management technologies and processes
* Experience using the Microsoft office suite of tools.
* At least one of the following appropriate certificates must be active and provided to Leidos upon candidate submission.
	+ An Active Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) certification or higher
	+ An Active Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Voice certification or higher
	+ An Active Cisco Certified Network Professional (CCNP) Data certification or higher
	+ An Active Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) Wireless certification or higher
	+ ITIL v3 Certifications
	+ Any CISCO or Aruba WLAN Certifications


Qualifications:
**Education and Years of Experience:*** Bachelor’s degree in a technical subject. Experience may be substituted for degree.

**Required and Desired Skills/Certifications:*** Demonstrate that security policies/GSP/IRM mandates were met/implemented correctly on network devices, best practices were implemented, new technologies deployed to meet customer needs, software levels were maintained, and global configurations were managed and updated.
* At least 5 years’ experience with supporting a large scale government network.
* Experience with the ITIL V3 IT Lifecycle Management Framework.

**Additional Requirements:*** Excellent oral and written communication skills.
* Ability to work in a fast-paced, dynamic environment.
* Flexible and adaptable to changing environment.
* Ability to interface with all levels of management.
* Ability to work on multiple tasks at the same time.
* Excellent time management, scheduling, and organizational skills.
* Ability to work independently or closely with other developers with minimal guidance.

 **Min Citizenship Status Required:** US Citizen Only  

Candidate must have the ability to obtain an IRS Moderate risk MBI clearance. A current active IRS MBI clearance, or having held one within the past 2 years is preferred.  

If candidate has no IRS MBI, a prior public trust or higher level clearance at another federal agency is highly preferred. Work may not begin until the MBI clearance is received. **Physical Requirements:** No Physical requirement needed for this position**.****Location:** No more than 50% of the time will be Telework. **Other 50% will require candidate to report to the New Carrollton MD location for 8 hour shifts.**

 **Working at DMI**
DMI is a diverse, prosperous, and rewarding place to work. Being part of the DMI family means we care about your wellbeing. We offer a variety of perks and benefits that help meet various interests and needs, while still having the opportunity to work directly with several of our award-winning, Fortune 1000 clients. The following categories make up your DMI wellbeing:

* Convenience/Concierge - Virtual visits through health insurance, pet insurance, commuter benefits, discount tickets for movies, travel, and many other items to provide convenience.
* Development – Annual performance management, continuing education, and tuition assistance, internal job opportunities along with career enrichment and advancement to help each employee with their professional and personal development.
* Financial – Generous 401k matches both pre-tax and post-tax (ROTH) contributions along with financial wellness education, EAP, Life Insurance and Disability help provide financial stability for each DMI employee.
* Recognition – Great achievements do not go unnoticed by DMI through Annual Awards ceremony, service anniversaries, peer-to-peer acknowledgment, employee referral bonuses.
* Wellness – Healthcare benefits, Wellness programs, Flu Shots, Biometric screenings, and several other wellness options.


Employees are valued for their talents and contributions. We all take pride in helping our customers achieve their goals, which in turn contributes to the overall success of the company. The company does and will take affirmative action to employ and advance in employment individuals with disabilities and protected veterans, and to treat qualified individuals without discrimination based on their physical or mental disability or veteran status. DMI is an Equal Opportunity Employer Minority/Female/Veterans/Disability. DMI maintains a drug-free workplace.

title: Service Network Recruiting Specialist
description:
**Service Network Recruiter - FULL TIME WITH BENEFITS**


**Pay Rate $17-$20/Hour**
Join Our Team at National Service Alliance!  

Are you passionate about network services and contributing to the operational success of a dynamic company? National Service Alliance is seeking a highly motivated and detail-oriented individual to join our team as a Network Service Recruiter.
**Summary**
The Service Network Recruiter responsibilities includes actively finding qualified service providers, educating them on our service standards, evaluating them, influencing them to join our repair network, and completing all necessary steps to add them to the system. This role acts as a representative for the company and will demonstrate high energy, excellent communication skills, and a high level of attention to detail. This role will provide identify opportunities to improve the recruitment process for all stakeholders.


**Essential Functions**


* Communicate with prospective service providers via email and phone


* Effectively explain National Service Alliance’s (NSA) repair processes, and standards of service


* Interview service providers using various methods (e.g. structured interviews, technical assessments, and behavioral questions)


* Evaluate service providers to determine suitability for NSA’s service network through research (reviewing social media, servicer review sites, local government sites, etc.)


* Articulate value proposition to service providers who are interested in the opportunity to receive dispatches from NSA and keep them engaged


* Effectively guide and assist service providers through onboarding processes in a timely manner.


* Effectively track and follow up with service provider leads throughout the onboarding process


**Competencies**


* Persuasive and high energy – ability to cold call service provider leads to encourage them to join network and overcome any rejection obstacles


* Strong organizational skills


* Attention to detail


* Ability to prioritize


* Excellent interpersonal skills and the ability to build strong relationships with internal and external stakeholders


* Strong verbal, and written communication skills


* Ability to work independently and as part of a team


* Process Improvement mindset - Ability point out potential improvements and or to create processes to improve business operations


**Required Education and Experience**


* 1+ years of servicer recruiting experience, claims adjudication or experience working within the service industry for consumer or home products.


* The ability to understand how service providers will use the NSA system in order to effectively educate during the onboarding process.


* Working knowledge of Microsoft Office, particularly MS Word and MS Excel


* The ability to communicate efficiently and effectively.


**Work Environment**


This is currently a remote position. It requires the use of standard office equipment such as computers, phones/mobile devices, internet appliances and filing cabinets. High Speed internet access that supports voice over IP is required. The position requires considerable contact with service providers, customers, and clients via phone, email and internal system documentation.


**Physical Demands**


The employee is regularly required to sit or stand to utilize standard office equipment such as computers, phones/mobile devices, to talk, hear, and type various communications and system inputs.


**Position Type and Expected Hours of Work**


This is a full-time hourly, nonexempt position. Typical working days and hours are Monday through Friday from 8:00 am to 5:00 pm. However, given the nature of the position and responsibilities, the position may require additional hours including but not limited to before and after regular working hours and travel during the work week and weekends.


This position is considered a remote working role and will require acknowledgement of the Company’s Remote Worker Agreement.


**Travel**


This position does not require travel.

title: LMS Administrator
description:
**Title:** Learning Management System (LMS) Administrator

  


**Location:** Remote

  


**Role:** The LMS Administrator is a member of a project team responsible for creating or updating online, in-class, and hybrid courses for US Air Force personnel. The LMS Administrator uploads eLearning courses to the Air Force’s myLearning LMS and other customer designated learning platforms, advising the project team on ways to optimize courseware for the target LMS(s). If you are looking for work that will challenge and grow your talents in new ways, this role is meant for you.

  


**Duties:**


* Upload, organize, and manage course content within the targeted LMS(s). This may involve creating course catalogs, setting up course structures, and ensuring content is up to date and accessible.
* Lead or participate in the functional testing of courseware on the LMS’s development and learner-facing environments.
* Provide technical support and troubleshooting assistance to students experiencing issues with the customer’s courseware on the LMS(s) such as course access issues and technical errors. Log and track requests for assistance using the customer’s Help Desk trouble-ticket system.
* Collaborate with the government personnel or contractors with principal responsibility for the LMSs, bringing certain user issues to their attention as well as assisting with testing of new LMS features and updates before they are deployed.
* Review user documentation on how to use the LMS(s) to access and complete the customer’s courseware. This may include creating course-specific user guides, tutorials, and conducting training sessions.
* Generate reports and analytics on user activity, course completion rates, assessment results, and other relevant metrics to assist the customer in evaluating the effectiveness of training programs and identifying areas for improvement.
* Participate in team meetings to remain abreast of project timelines and anticipate LMS administration activities.
* Advise the project team and customer on ways to improve courseware operability on the targeted LMS(s).
* Perform other duties as assigned.

  


**Technical:**


* Comfortable with various LMS platforms and use of MS Office and Adobe products.
* Organized and detail oriented, able to simultaneously manage multiple tasks.

  


**Education:**


* Bachelor’s Degree in education, educational technology, network administration, computer science, computer programming, or other relevant disciplines.
* Evidence of post-degree training and/or certification on specific LMSs is a significant plus.

  


**Experience:**


* Three (3) or more years of experience as an LMS Administrator; any experience with the US Air Force’s myLearning LMS is a plus but is not a requirement of the position.

**Company Background:**

Since its founding in 2007, APV's portfolio of clients has grown significantly. As a well-established, woman-owned, Small Business Association-certified 8(a) company, APV has become a small business leader in supporting a multitude of clients, from more than 15 federal and state agencies, including the Department of Defense, to civilian organizations. As of , APV has executed 70 plus prime contracts and received exceptional performance and client service ratings. APV is currently working on more than 30 government projects.


APV is a mature company dedicated to quality and exceptional delivery to meet its clients’ missions. We believe that the highest quality consultants are an essential part of this. We hire the best and take care of the people who come to work for us. We continue to maintain 96% employee satisfaction and have a high retention rate, well above the industry average for our small business peers. We do this by offering a competitive compensation plan and providing leadership that is dedicated to employee growth and advancement.



Candidates must meet the minimum qualifications to receive further consideration.

title: Sr. System Administrator - Night Shift
description:
Job Snapshot


**Employee Type:**  

Full-Time


**Location:**  

Work From Home
 

**Job Type:**  

Management


**Experience:**  

Not Specified


**Date Posted:**  

2/22/2024


Job Description


**Summary**



Supports customers’ server and network environments as member of Logicalis’ 24x7x365 operations team, headquartered in West Chester, Ohio. Responsible for support, incident management, problem management and change management for devices and resources monitored by Logicalis Managed Services including Windows / Unix / Linux servers, System i devices, network devices and applications as well as other supported configuration items for internal and client systems. Provides guidance as technical and process subject-matter-expert (SME) for Managed Services’ System Administrators (Tier 2).


**Essential Duties and Responsibilities**


* Performs break/fix troubleshooting, server/software updates and feature enhancements to Windows, Linux and Unix servers, Cisco networking devices and general IT infrastructure.


* Responds and solves customer issues utilizing technology tools, procedures, and training through awareness of service offerings and Service Level Agreements (SLAs).


* Develops, conducts, and assesses all cross-training needs for Managed Services System Administrators (Tier 2).


* Creates and maintains technical and process documentation for troubleshooting purposes.


* Understands Information Technology Infrastructure Library (ITIL) and follows predefined ITIL incident, problem and change management processes in place for each customer when working to resolve customer requests or outages.


* Maintains current knowledge of core service offerings and SLAs. Understands all Logicalis service offerings to better support customer as well as expanding any service offering to current customers.


* Demonstrates and actively promotes an understanding and commitment to the mission of Logicalis through performing behaviors consistent with the organization's values.


* Maintains a working knowledge of applicable Federal, State, and Local laws and regulations as well as policies and procedures of Logicalis in order to ensure adherence in a manner that reflects honest, ethical and professional behaviors.


* Supports and conducts self in a manner consistent with customer service expectations.


**Supervisory Responsibilities**


This job has no supervisory responsibilities.


**Qualifications**

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.


**Education/Experience/Technical Requirements/Certifications**



Equivalent combination accepted.



**Education:**


* Associate Degree in a related field.


**Experience / Technical Requirements**


* 5 years of experience in multiple technologies, including any of the following:


	+ Windows Server administration: 2012, 2016, 2019, Active Directory, Group Policy
	+ Linux server administration
	+ Clustering: Citrix, VMware
	+ Virtualization: VMware and/or Hyper-V
	+ Backup solutions: Veeam, NetBackup, Azure Recovery Services Vaults
	+ Microsoft Azure administration, Azure Virtual Desktop, Azure Active Directory


* Experience working in ITIL-based incident tracking system (Service-Now, CA Service Desk).


* Understanding of network and server monitoring tools and technologies.


* Proficient use of all Microsoft Office applications.


**Certifications**


* Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP)
* Microsoft Certified IT Professional (MCITP)
* Red Hat Certified System Administrator (RHCSA)
* Linux Certified Administrator (LCA)
* Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA)
* CompTIA A+ / CompTIA Network+


**Other Skills and Abilities**


* Ability to execute tasks, projects, and troubleshooting with minimal supervision and with a sense of urgency.


* Detail-oriented with the ability to multitask and prioritize to meet critical SLA deadlines.


* Excellent customer service and interaction skills.


* Outstanding verbal, written, and technical/business communication skills.


* Must be able to accommodate requests from multiple customers and Logicalis Account Executives and respond in a timely fashion.


**Physical Demands**



The physical demands described here are representative of those that should be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.



While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is required to either be sitting, standing, or in a similar posture as well as talk, see, hear, and use hands and arms. The employee may occasionally be required to move about, climb steps or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee may also occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.



The above statements describe the general nature and level of work being performed by individuals assigned to this classification. This is not intended to be an exhaustive list of all responsibilities and duties required of personnel so classified.



Logicalis is an Equal Opportunity Employer. It is our policy to employ people who are qualified by reason of education, training, experience, and demonstrated performance. We value diversity and inclusion at our company. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, national origin, sexual orientation, gender identity and gender expression, marital status, age, height, weight, disability, veteran status, or any other reason prohibited by applicable federal or state laws.


**Salary Compensation Range**: **$64,100 to $83,300**

title: Senior System Administrator (Linux)/Network Administrator
description:
**Senior System Administrator (Linux)/Network Administrator**
=============================================================

**WHO WE ARE:**

At HHS Tech Group (HTG), our work matters, and each of us makes a difference in the lives of people every day.


HTG is a leader in the development and delivery of innovative, purpose-built modular software and technology solutions to clients in the commercial and government sectors.


**WHAT WE DO:**

HHS Tech Group creates innovative, purpose-built technology products and solutions, resulting in value and positive, quantifiable impact for our clients and the people they serve.


Our people bring our software to life through collaborative relationships with our clients, working as a team, helping to solve complex problems that create positive personal and community impact for the people our clients serve.


Each day, our software products and our people are making a difference.


**OUR PEOPLE MATTER MOST:**

Improving the lives of others and making an impact daily is no simple task. We are dedicated to our team’s professional and personal growth and well-being. Some key rewards and benefits include:


* Generously sponsored Medical Insurance
* Fully paid premiums on dental, vision, life, and disability insurance.
* Generous 401k matching program (100% match up to 6%)
* Tuition and Certification reimbursement
* Open PTO policy

**Join us!**

**WHO WE ARE HIRING:**

**Senior System Administrator (Linux)/Network Administrator**

 **WHAT YOU WILL DO:**


HHS Technology Group is seeking a highly skilled and motivated Senior System Administrator with a proven track record of expertise in Linux, AWS, Kubernetes, virtualization, networking, and leadership. The ideal candidate will have a strong background in managing Kubernetes clusters, virtual machines, and possess the ability to lead and mentor a team. This individual will play a crucial role in optimizing our deployment processes, enhancing system reliability, and shaping the infrastructure architecture. Experience in networking, Agile methodologies, continuous integration, and continuous deployment (CI/CD), AWS cloud services, and proficiency in Java are essential for this role. This role is fully remote.

 **ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES:**

* Lead the design, deployment, and maintenance of Kubernetes clusters and virtual machines, ensuring high availability, scalability, and performance.
* Provide technical leadership and mentorship to the DevOps team, fostering a collaborative and innovative work environment.
* Collaborate with software development teams to architect, implement, and maintain CI/CD pipelines for efficient software deployment and updates.
* Manage networking configurations and security protocols within Kubernetes environments to ensure optimal communication and data flow.
* Drive the adoption of Agile methodologies, enabling rapid development, iteration, and delivery of software projects.
* Design, implement, and maintain infrastructure as code (IaC) using tools such as Terraform, CloudFormation, or similar technologies.
* Utilize AWS cloud services to architect, deploy, and optimize cloud-based solutions, ensuring cost-effectiveness and scalability.
* Investigate and troubleshoot production incidents, applying root cause analysis and implementing corrective actions.
* Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements, define infrastructure needs, and align technical solutions with business goals.
* Stay up-to-date with industry trends, best practices, and emerging technologies, integrating relevant advancements into the DevOps process.

 **MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:**

+ Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Technology, or a related field (or equivalent experience).
+ Extensive experience (5+ years) in Kubernetes orchestration and administration, including cluster deployment, scaling, and management.
+ 3+ years of experience on Prometheus, Grafana, NewRelic and ELK for monitoring the application.
+ 10+ years’ experience on Linux System Administrator and Networking.
+ Strong leadership capabilities demonstrated through previous team leadership roles.
+ Proficiency in networking concepts, protocols, and security practices within Kubernetes environments.
+ Strong background and understanding of Linux System Administrator
+ Solid understanding of Agile methodologies and experience working in Agile development teams.
+ Hands-on experience with CI/CD pipelines and related tools (Jenkins, GitLab CI/CD, etc.).
+ In-depth knowledge of AWS cloud services and infrastructure architecture.
+ Good understanding of Networking and infrastructure security.
+ Experience with AWS Direct Connect, Site-to-Site VPN, Transit Gateway, Equinix and Megaport.
+ Flexibility for the occasional need for off-hours work to support our customers.

 **DESIRED SKILLS:**

* Excellent problem-solving skills and a proactive attitude towards identifying and resolving technical challenges.
* Strong communication and collaboration skills, able to effectively convey complex technical concepts to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
* Certifications such as Certified Kubernetes Administrator (CKA), AWS Certified DevOps Engineer, and relevant networking certifications are a plus.


Applicants for employment in the US must have work authorization that does not, now or in the future, require sponsorship of a visa for employment authorization in the United States.


EEO Statement


HHS Technology Group is an equal opportunity employer. All aspects of employment including the decision to hire, promote, discipline, or discharge, will be based on merit, competence, performance, and business needs. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, marital status, age, national origin, ancestry, physical or mental disability, medical condition, pregnancy, genetic information, gender, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, veteran status, or any other status protected under federal, state, or local law.

title: Senior Network Administrator
description:
Senior Network Administrator

Hybrid - San Jose, CA

* Maintains hardware, software, network equipment, network monitoring systems / equipment, and security software equipment including firewalls, intrusion detection/prevention, endpoint protection, SIEM, virtual and physical compute systems, storage area network (SAN), VPN, access control system, and telephone system
* Hands-on experience with Cisco Meraki, Palo Alto Firewalls, VMware, SD-WAN networking technologies, and/or other relevant technologies.
* Knowledge and understanding of L2/L3 networking protocols.
* Knowledge and understanding of DNS and DHCP.
* Maintains network and related compute environments including systems software, applications software, hardware, and configurations.
* Performs disaster recovery operations and data backups when required.
* Protects data, software, and hardware by coordinating, planning and implementing network security measures.
* Troubleshoots, diagnoses and resolves hardware, software, and other network and system issues.
* Proactively maintains and replaces faulty network hardware components when required.
* Proactively monitor network availability/uptime utilizing network performance and monitoring tools.
* Operates and monitors systems to ensure highest level performance of networks and computer systems.
* Coordinates computer network access and use.
* Designs, configures and tests networking software, computer hardware, and operating system software.
* Creates and continuously updates network diagrams and documentation to ensure up-to-date and accurate
* Provides technical leadership and actively participates in selecting and implementing new systems
* Mentors team members in order to ensure proper procedures are followed for highest level of uptime and security

Job Type: Contract

Pay: $80.00 per hour

Experience:

* Meraki: 8 years (Required)
* Palo Alto Firewall: 8 years (Required)
* VMWare: 6 years (Required)
* SAN: 7 years (Required)
* SD-WAN: 8 years (Required)

Willingness to travel:

* 100% (Required)

Work Location: Remote

title: Network Development Specialist_ Temporary Position
description:
Network Development Specialist
  
  

Who are we?
  
Versant Health is one of the nation’s leading administrators of managed vision care, serving millions of our clients’ members nationwide. We are driven by our mission to help members enjoy the wonders of sight through healthy eyes and vision.
  
  

As a Versant Health associate, you can enjoy a comprehensive Total Rewards package, which includes health and dental insurance, tuition reimbursement, 401(k) with company match, pet insurance, no-cost-to-you vision insurance for you and your qualified dependents. We are also invested in your success. There are many opportunities for advancement and development throughout all stages of your career with us.
  
  

See how you can make a difference with the support of strong leadership and a team environment.
  
  

See Everything, Be Anything™.
  
  

What are we looking for?
  
The Network Recruiting Specialist will be responsible for recruitment of vision providers to Versant Health’s networks according to established goals and priorities. This individual will also be responsible for following up with providers undergoing the credentialing process, providing service and education to network physician/providers during the recruitment process, maintenance of the network as required, amongst other duties. This role will require a highly motivated individual with medical surgical recruitment experience, as well as facility contracting experience with excellent negotiations, sales, interpersonal and communication skills and the willingness to work hard to meet goals.
  
  

**Where you will have an impact:**  

* Recruits and contracts new vision providers and facilities into Superior Vision and Davis Vision networks according to established goals and priorities
* Takes inbound and makes outbound phone calls to vision providers who have requested information, who have been recruited or who have been nominated by members
* Negotiate fee schedules with new and existing vision providers in accordance with corporate goals and standards as required and review for completeness of application materials
* Obtain and process application materials and credentialing documents as required and review for completeness
* Assist in other projects as necessary
* Educate providers on plan designs, processes
* Build and maintain relationships with provider community
* Work with provider practices to resolve complaints, claims issues as needed
* Generate other ad hoc reports as needed
* General supervision on completed work and monitoring against established goals
* Requires daily use of considerable discretion, judgment and independent problem solving
* Work with Director of Medical Network Development identify appropriate recruitment strategies
* Have a quiet space conductive to working from home
* Other duties as assigned


What’s necessary to do the job?
  
  

* Preferred bachelor’s degree. High School diploma/GED or equivalent combination of experience and education
* One (1) year of related experience
* Experience in Medical Network Development
* Knowledge and experience in the insurance, health, or vision care industry preferred
* Proficiency in MicroSoft Office


HIPAA & Security Requirements
  
All Associates must comply with the Health Insurance Portability Accountability Act of 1996 (HIPAA) as it pertains to disclosures of protected health information (PHI) as described in the Notice of Privacy Practices and HIPAA Privacy Policies and Procedures. As a component of job roles and responsibilities, Associates may have access to covered information, cardholder data or other confidential customer information which must be protected at all times. As a result, Associates must explicitly adhere to all data security guidelines established within the Company’s Privacy & Security Training Program.
  
  

Versant Health will never request money from candidates who seek employment with us and will never ask for any payment as part of the recruitment process.
  
  

Versant Health is a proud Equal Employment Opportunity and Affirmative Action employer dedicated to attracting, retaining, and developing a diverse and inclusive workforce. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment at Versant Health without regards to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions), sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, age, disability, national origin, marital or domestic/civil partnership status, genetic information, citizenship status, uniformed service member or veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.
  
  

The wage range for applicants for this position is [$41,600 to $44,720].
  
All incentives and benefits are subject to the applicable plan terms.

title: Systems Administrator (Overnight/Day)
description:

title: System Administrator II, Windows
description:
Company Overview:

#LI-Remote
Shriners Children’s is a family that respects, supports, and values each other. We are engaged in providing excellence in patient care, embracing multi-disciplinary education, and research with global impact. We foster a learning environment that values evidenced based practice, experience, innovation, and critical thinking. Our compassion, integrity, accountability, and resilience defines us as leaders in pediatric specialty care for our children and their families.
Job Overview:

Shriners Children's is the premier pediatric burn, orthopaedic, spinal cord injury, cleft lip and palate, and pediatric subspecialties medical center. We have an opportunity for a System Administrator II, Windows reporting into our Corporate Headquarters location.  

The System Administrator II, Windows works independently or in teams and leverages their technical knowledge, expertise, and systems analysis techniques and procedures to make proper decisions in regards to the proper management, monitoring of systems, testing, problem troubleshooting, providing advice and recommendations, etc, and upkeep of the enterprise’s technological system architecture. Individual consults with users to determine system requirements in regards to items such as hardware, software, or system functional specifications. The Administrator possesses the ability to work independently or in teams in the design and implementation of hardware and software configurations and upgrades, works to procure appropriate hardware and software components and installs. Specifies server equipment, loads and configures operating systems (Windows and LINUX) and systems software, and ensures that they work on the network. The Administrator is responsible for creating and updating documentation such as policies, procedures, technical configurations, Technology Recovery Plans (TRPs), reports, Change Control, and customer facing documents. This position provides support services for Headquarters, hospitals and members of the Boards of Trustees and Directors. Provides tier 3 support for other teams within the IS Department and hospitals.  


Responsibilities:
**Application Support:** Levers technical knowledge to assist the Business and Clinical application teams in the design, installation, and upgrades of the applications software. The individual must be able to work independently or in teams and lever their technical knowledge, expertise, and systems analysis techniques and procedures to make proper decisions in regards to the proper management, monitoring of systems, testing, problem troubleshooting, providing advice and recommendations, etc, and upkeep of the enterprise’s technological system architecture. Individual consults with users to determine system requirements in regards to items such as hardware, software, or system functional specifications. Ability to work independently or in teams in the design and implantation of hardware and software configurations and upgrades, works to procure appropriate hardware and software components and installs. Specifies server equipment, loads and configures operating systems (Windows and LINUX) and systems software, and ensures that they work on the network. Installs, monitors, and maintain all SQL databases for all locations. The individual designs, programs, tests, and documents scripts. **Customer Support (HQ and Hospitals):** This position provides support services for Headquarters, hospitals and members of the Boards of Trustees and Directors. Provides tier 3 support for other teams within the IS Department and hospitals. Tier 3 support of: Active Directory, servers, backups\\restores, internet access, antivirus software, Citrix, Microsoft SQL server, LINUX, IBM web sphere, VMware / Hyper-V, cryptosystems ( CA / RSA), Exchange, and Business / Clinical application systems. Duties include On Call rotation for after hours and weekend support.  

  

**Documentation:** Develops and maintains all the technical\\training documentation for all the assigned systems and projects. Responsible for creating and updating documentation such as SOPs (Standard Operating Procedures), policies, procedures, technical configurations, Technology Recovery Plans (TRPs), reports, Change Control, and customer facing documents.  

  

**Product/Vendor Evaluation and Recommendation:** Systematic evaluation, recommendation and/or selection of items such as vendors and their products including hardware, software packages, communications products, consulting services, systems integration services, etc. Techniques used include side-by-side weighted assessments, price-performance analyses, cost-benefit analyses, etc… Often asked to participate on a selection committee as a technical advisor. **Other Responsibilities:**  

* Asset management and tracking.
* Ensure appropriate software licensing.
* Work with third parties to implement and support packaged solutions as necessary.
* Coordinate activities with more senior Network Support Specialists on related matters.
* Plan, install, configure, test, tune, maintain, monitors and upgrade servers and disk configurations.
* Monitor local and remote hardware and software performance and ensure that appropriate resources are available on network server equipment. 5%
* Plan, install, configure, test, tune, maintain, monitor and upgrade local and remote SQL databases and remote e-mail systems.
* Ensure that physical and logical security of equipment and networks is maintained.
* Develop and maintain documentation.
* Plan, install, configure, maintain and administer WINS and/or DNS for the enterprise.
  

The person in this role must complete and pass any Epic required training programs (Epic Bridges Interfaces and Data Courier Administration) within 6 months of hire.
Qualifications:
**Experience Required:*** Current Bachelor's Degree or 4 years of system administrator experience in lieu of degree
* Current technical certification or additional 3 years of experience working with Windows OS including most recent Windows server versions, AD (Group Policy object management) and DNS.
* Citrix, IBM web sphere, VMware / Hyper-V, cryptosystems ( CA / RSA)
* MS Exchange / MS Office 365
* MS Azure or AWS (Amazon Web Services)
* Experience troubleshooting TCP/IP, routing and IP troubleshooting techniques.
* Knowledge of local and network attached devices
* Experience diagnosing hardware and software problems and implementing corrective measures
* Experience with SQL and relational database management systems
* Experience in supporting and / or using a Privileged Access Management solution such as Cyberark
* Imprivata
* Must complete and pass any Epic required training programs (Epic Bridges Interfaces [pre-requisite] and Epic Data Courier Administration) within 6 months of hire.

 **Experience Preferred:*** Bachelor's Degree preferred, or 4 years of equivalent experience

title: Senior Onedrive Business Administrator
description:
Provide Microsoft 365 (M365) core program oversight and support Program Management Office activities at the Enterprise level across the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), which consists of 28 Business Units (BUs) and Information Technology (IT) Organizations. M365 enterprise is a cloud-powered productivity platform that preserves and shares information across the IRS using MS Exchange Servers, MS Teams, OneDrive for Business (ODB), SharePoint Online (SPO), Project Online (PJO), and Power Platforms (PP) tools.


The Increase Reduction Act New Hire (IRA-NH) signed by Congress August 16, 2022, mandates the IRS to improve the taxpayer experience and compliance. This M365 task order will ensure that the M365 tools are in place to provide the taxpayers with the ability to navigate the IRS systems with ease and to ensure taxpayer compliance.

 **Job Description:**


The Contractor shall provide OneDrive for Business Administration of M365 business cloud systems and applications. Oversee and execute tasks pertaining to the maintenance and administration of the IRS Enterprise. Ensure bandwidth is available for increase of new hires.

**Job Requirements:**

  

* Technical Support - Ensure OneDrive for Business Admin Center is operational with no disruption and/or escalate concerns to program lead as soon as possible.
* Maintain desktop application, web access, and mobile application accounts.
* Maintenance of the OneDrive for Business applications.
* Monitor application health information and escalation concerns.
* Provide technical support, manage, delete, restore, and create M365 roles & groups for OneDrive users.
* Create, reset, and delete Privileged Accounts.
* Assist with group policy object (GPO) updates.
* Implement industry best practices.
* Tickets – Service Now - Review ticket queue.
* Ticket update and completion.
* Responding to end user inquiries by e-mail.
* Reassign tickets to appropriate personnel or groups.
* Mailbox -Responding to employee inquiries. Determine resolution.
* Utilizing FAQs, How-To’s, or other reference materials as necessary.
* Guide employees on how to enter ServiceNow tickets or have employee attend applicable training.
* Identify Trends related to OneDrive and Provide updates on trends.
* Assist in identifying resolution to update (Standard Operating Procedures) SOP and reference materials.
* Status Report - Provide bi-weekly status reports that encompasses schedule, M365 deliverables for each tool, action items, risks, mitigations, escalations, accomplishments, and closures.

 **Job Required Skills:**

* Contractor shall have a minimum 5 years’ experience supporting Microsoft 365 (M365) Cloud Based Suite in a large corporate/government environment.
* Contractor shall have excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain technologies and technical business concepts to multiple audiences.
* Contractor shall establish and maintain effective business unit relationships.

 **Desired Outcome:**

  

The Contractor shall provide successful OneDrive for Business Administration skills to the M365 Program Management Office (PMO) to ensure successful migrations and timely completion of specified projects.

**About the Organization**


Constellation West is an award winning company that delivers Information Technology (IT) engineering services and solutions along with non-IT subject matter expertise world-wide. Established in 1997, Constellation West continues as an industry leader, partnering with key organizations. As a prime contractor or preferred subcontractor, we have a continual list of opportunities to fill across the nation with multiple agencies such as the Department of Veteran Affairs, Department of Defense, civilian agencies, and national intelligence community. Many of the positions supporting U.S. federal government require our employees be granted security clearances.


Constellation West provides fully integrated solutions spanning all aspects of system/network engineering, system/network administration, data management, information assurance, quality assurance, full lifecycle support, software development, and geospatial information services. Constellation West looks for the right people ready to step up and be part of a dynamic team.


If you are looking for a new challenge and a rewarding opportunity to apply your expertise, knowledge, and problem solving skills, come join our team! Constellation West offers competitive salary and benefits including:
