title: Manager, Network Operations – Remote
description:
**Job Summary:**


The **Manager of Network Operations** oversees the day-to-day functions of Case Coordination to ensure all patient visits are efficiently and effectively scheduled. This position is also a key role in facilitating operations for two clinical programs in the Puerto Rico market. Additionally, due to previous field experience, the Manager of Network Operations assists the Billing team with invoicing operations as needed.

**Supervisory Responsibilities**:


This position oversees the Case Coordination management and staff members. In addition, the Manager of Network Operations works to consistently streamline day-to-day operations for Case Coordination staff. Manages personnel matters as needed.

**Duties / Responsibilities**:

* Manages and performs all case coordination duties for two clinical programs in Puerto Rico market. Operations include service request intake, appointment scheduling, confirmation calls (delegates to Spanish speaking Patient Care Coordinator as needed), reminder emails, and the distribution of visit results to prescribing HCPs.
* Monitor program support inbox for escalations and address emails as received.
* Oversees the day-to-day functions of med-kit shipment for all participating clinical programs. Initiates escalations as needed.
* Run daily reports to ensure Case Coordination staff is efficiently managing workload.
* Facilitates and leads virtual training for macular edema eye exam machine as needed.
* Prioritizes and communicates market needs for clinical programs to Network Development for recruitment.
* Meets with new clinicians before first visit to ensure the caregiver is prepared for the appointment.
* Assists with billing and invoicing for all clinical programs. Meets with Billing team at the end of each month to ensure the ledger is accurate.

**Required Skills, Education & Abilities:**

* Must be proficient with Microsoft Office, especially MS Teams, Excel, Word, and Outlook. » Thorough understanding of all Network Operations operating rhythms.
* Excellent verbal and written communication and interpersonal skills.
* Strong managerial and diplomacy skills.
* Prior experience as a Patient Care Coordination Lead (preferred).
* Willingness to work nights/weekends as needed.
* Excellent organizational skills with attention to detail.
* Excellent analytical, decision-making, and problem-solving skills.
* Associates degree (required).
* Related field experience in healthcare administration (preferred).
* Management experience (required).


#LI-CES


IQVIA is a leading global provider of advanced analytics, technology solutions and clinical research services to the life sciences industry. We believe in pushing the boundaries of human science and data science to make the biggest impact possible – to help our customers create a healthier world. Learn more at https://jobs.iqvia.com


We are committed to providing equal employment opportunities for all, including veterans and candidates with disabilities. https://jobs.iqvia.com/eoe


IQVIA’s ability to operate and provide certain services to customers and partners necessitates IQVIA and its employees meet specific requirements regarding COVID-19 vaccination status. https://jobs.iqvia.com/covid-19-vaccine-status


The potential base pay range for this role is 90,000-94,000 annually. The actual base pay offered may vary based on a number of factors including job-related qualifications such as knowledge, skills, education, and experience; location; and/or schedule (full or part-time). Dependent on the position offered, incentive plans, bonuses, and/or other forms of compensation may be offered, in addition to a range of health and welfare and/or other benefits.

title: System Administrator
description:
**Introduction to Briefly**


Briefly, is a support organization, professionally running the back-office operations of a tech-enabled, highly selective, global law firm consistently recognized for its excellence, innovation, and teamwork throughout its 45 offices in 14 countries and five continents. This disruptive business model has widely become known amongst the most innovative in the legal industry prioritizing collaboration, dynamic innovation, consistent excellence, agility, and efficiency. These core principles provide our firm with an insightful understanding of how we can continue to push our growth year over year.


**Position Summary:**

We are currently seeking a full-time, highly skilled System Administrator to join our dynamic legal firm's IT team. The ideal candidate will possess expertise in Azure Active Directory group management, telecom, data migration, Citrix, software packaging, endpoint imaging, and security development. As a System Administrator, you will play a crucial role in ensuring the stability, security, and efficiency of our IT infrastructure to meet the unique needs of our legal practice. This position is a fully remote opportunity.

**Essential Functions & Responsibilities**

* A problem solver, that can act as technical project lead, manage workload and complete tasks on time.
* Experience in the support of mid-large-scale environments, multi-users, multi-site.
* Experience in the support of a remote work force, networks and PCs.
* Well-versed with the implementation and managing of Microsoft solutions in the Cloud & OnPrem.
* Windows Deployment Technologies - Imaging, Sysprep, Provisioning Packages, DISM
* Entra ID
* Azure
* Windows 10/11, Server
* SQL
* SharePoint
* Intune Device Management - Conditional Access, Compliance, Security Baseline, and App Policies
* Group Policy
* Conditional access
* Microsoft 365
* Scripting - PowerShell, VBScript
* Software and hardware provisioning
* Access Management - Matrix, RBAC, Automation, Lifecycle management.
* Can provide complete lifecycle support of existing and new environments including maintenance, software updates, troubleshooting, vulnerability management and remediation.
* Phone VOIP - Knowledge of MS Voice and Ring Central
* Experience with RBRO, iManage Work, iManage SPM,
* Experience with data management solutions and data migration processes.
* Assist in research and procurement of firm wide software and hardware solutions.
* Familiar with using PowerShell for automation
* Administer IaaS, PaaS, and SaaS based enterprise applications.
* Document processes and troubleshooting steps for knowledge base articles utilized by other IT Support members.
* Communicate with users to understand, identify, document, and resolve problems.
* Provide telephone, in-person, and online support to end-users.
* Coordinate activities with the IT leaders.

**Essential Capabilities**

**Azure Active Directory Groups:**

* Design, implement, manage, and maintain Azure Active Directory groups and policies to streamline and ensure proper access controls and permissions.
* Ensure proper integration of endpoint devices with Azure AD for seamless authentication and access control.
* Troubleshoot Azure AD-related issues and implement necessary improvements.
* Manage Azure Active Directory groups, ensuring accurate user access and permissions.
* Collaborate with other IT teams to integrate Azure Active Directory with other systems and applications.
* Monitor and respond to security incidents related to Azure Active Directory.
* Design and manage Azure Active Directory groups to streamline access control and permissions.
* Collaborate with IT administrators to ensure AAD groups align with organizational policies and legal compliance requirements.

 **Endpoint Troubleshooting and Support:**

* Provide advanced technical support for endpoint-related issues, collaborating with the IT support team to resolve incidents promptly.
* Develop and maintain documentation for troubleshooting procedures and best practices.

 **Endpoint Management:**

* Familiarity with the development, implementation, and management of endpoint strategies and solutions for endpoint configuration, deployment, and troubleshooting.
* Familiarity with software packaging and deployment.
* Knowledge in supporting legal-specific software and applications.

**Collaboration and Communication:**

* Work closely with cross-functional teams, including IT, legal, and security teams, to align endpoint strategies with organizational goals.
* Communicate effectively with end-users, providing training and documentation as needed.

 **Documentation and Training:**

* Create comprehensive documentation for system processes and management, network diagrams and configurations.
* Provide knowledge transfer for IT staff and end-users as required.

 **Education & Experience:**

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field.
* Proficiency in scripting languages such as PowerShell for automation.
* Proven experience in software packaging, endpoint imaging, and security development.
* In-depth knowledge of software packaging tools, endpoint imaging processes, and security best practices.
* Hands-on experience with Azure Active Directory, group management, and integration.
* Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving, communication, and collaboration skills.
* Experience in supporting law firms preferred.

**Job Related Competencies**

* Technical capabilities as described above
* Solution oriented
* Attention to detail
* Customer focused
* Ability to work independently
* Commitment to operational improvements and efficiency
* Integrity
* Leadership
* Strategic Thinking

**Equal Employment Opportunity**


Briefly, Inc. is committed to a policy of Equal Employment Opportunity. We do not discriminate on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, sexual orientation, gender identity, genetic information, veteran status, or any other protected status under applicable law. Our firm values diversity and inclusion, fostering an environment where all employees are treated with respect and dignity. Discrimination or harassment based on any protected characteristic is strictly prohibited. We welcome candidates from diverse backgrounds to apply for opportunities within our firm.

**Accommodation for Applicants with Disabilities**


Applicants with disabilities may be entitled to reasonable accommodation under the Americans with Disabilities Act and certain state or local laws. A reasonable accommodation is a change in the way things are normally done which will ensure an equal employment opportunity without imposing undue hardship on Briefly. If you have a disability or special need and need assistance participating in the application process, please let us know.

**E-Verify**


This employer participates in E-Verify and will provide the federal government with your form I-9 information to confirm you are authorized to work in the U.S.

title: Learning Management System Administrator
description:
**About Sound:**

  



Headquartered in Tacoma, WA, Sound Physicians is a physician-founded and led, national, multi-specialty medical group made up of more than 1,000 business colleagues and 4,000 physicians, APPs, CRNAs, and nurses practicing in 400-plus hospitals across 45 states. Founded in 2001, and with specialties in emergency and hospital medicine, critical care, anesthesia, and telemedicine, Sound has a reputation for innovating and leading through an ever-changing healthcare landscape — with patients at the center of the universe.

  


**Sound Physicians offers a competitive benefits package inclusive of the items below, and more:**


* Medical insurance, Dental insurance, and Vision insurance
* Health care and dependent care flexible spending account
* 401(k) retirement savings plan with a company match
* Paid time off (PTO) begins accruing immediately upon start date at a rate of 15 days per year, in accordance with Sound's PTO policy
* Ten company-paid holidays per year

  


**About Our Team**



The Recruiting and People Development team provides Sound Physicians colleagues with innovative, forward-thinking, and practical people solutions in recruiting, onboarding, learning and leadership development, coaching, performance, and talent planning (Talent Reviews, Succession Planning, and Emerging Leader programs).


**Our Team MISSION:** We come to the table, as a partner, to build relationships, promote diversity of thought, and ignite excitement to create lasting impressions in healthcare.


**Our Team VISION:** Innovate to elevate our Most Valuable Resource – Our Sound Colleagues


**We are FUN:** Yes, self-proclaimed but can be verified.

  


**About the Role**



We are looking for a Learning Management System (LMS) administrator to collaborate with the People Development team and Sound Physicians stakeholders nationwide to support our learning and leadership initiatives. This position reports to the Senior People Development Partner while supporting the People Development team. **In this role you have three primary areas of focus:**

  


**The Details:** This is a virtual, work-from-home opportunity.

  


**Product Manager (Technical):**


* Manage and administer the Cornerstone OnDemand learning management system, including the ongoing design, configuration, testing, deployment, and end-user training for the Sound network.
* Continue to improve and develop the modern learning user interface in the learning portal and mobile learning app using adult learning best practices.
* Continuously evaluate tools/processes to ensure Sound has the best-in-class user experience that offers efficient, high-quality, and seamless learning.
* Build and maintain a strategic relationship with LMS vendor ensuring Sound’s LMS is current, compliant, and working as designed to help minimize/mitigate any technical issues between our systems.
* Provide technical troubleshooting support to Sound stakeholders as related to learning programs and LMS features.
* Manage learning catalog management to ensure current, compliant, and relevant learning content is available within Sound Institute (Cornerstone).
* Manage Cornerstone’s role-based access, communication, and training to colleagues with access to ensure they are fully equipped to support their teams.

  


**Reporting and Analytics:**


* Drive data, analytics, and reporting needs proactively for business stakeholders to drive decision making and/or provide valid, actionable insights based on learning effectiveness measures.
* Establish and maintain a robust reporting framework, gather key analytics to create data visualizations, and have Domain knowledge.

  


**Learning Design and Development:**


* Create innovative, functional learning solutions with streamlined processes to solve challenges and meet the needs of the customer (ILT, vILT, eLearning blended solutions).
* Ability to exercise latitude to determine best learning solution approach.
* Develop content focused on healthcare regulatory requirements and general compliance – internal/external facing.
* Assist with virtual production support (Teams, Adobe Connect, and Zoom)
* Manage multiple projects simultaneously in a fast-paced, often ambiguous environment while delivering high-quality work on time.
* Serve as peer mentor and/or coach to learning colleagues and members of the Sound network, providing one-on-one training, as well as in-person/virtual Sound professional development training sessions.

  


**What we are looking for:**

  



A successful candidate will have a demonstrated track record of a combination of these values, knowledge, and experience:

  


**Values:**


* **Self-motivated:** Proactively jumps in to start a task or project with limited direction; asks to take on more responsibility and what’s next.
* **Driven:** Motivated to succeed and get things done at a high level of achievement.
* **Intellectually curious:** Demonstrates a genuine interest in learning new things and wants to know the reason “why” behind the way things are done.
* **Persistent:** Demonstrates the ability to “keep at it” even when obstacles or challenges are present; returns to the work at hand after a change of course.
* **Resourceful:** Proactive willingness to utilize available information and tools to figure things out.

  


**Knowledge:**


* Thorough knowledge of web-based content development and deployment systems, Learning Management Systems (LMS) or Learning Content Management Systems (LCMS) experience.
* Adult Learning Theory (e.g., readiness to learn, orientation to learning, learning experience).
* Bachelor’s Degree in HR, Training, Computer Science, or related field of study and/or 4 years of experience in related field accepted.
* Knowledge of Audience and Training Needs Assessment best practices and processes.
* People, Process, Programs, and System Integrations: understand all the data, dependencies and integration across the learning people experience.
* Design Thinking / User-Centric approach to solution design and implementation
* Proficiency in Articulate 360
* Proficiency in Adobe Creative Suite, specifically Photoshop and Adobe Premier Pro
* Proficiency in Word, Excel, and Power Point
* Analytical skills in validating data as well as quickly performing ad hoc analysis

  


**Experience:**


* 4+ years’ experience working with Learning Management Systems (preferred Cornerstone)
* Experience in data, analytics, and reporting
* Experience in instructional design in developing learning content based on best adult learning theories and delivery modalities (e.g., blending learning, micro- and social learning)
* A successful record in the design of blended learning experiences that include simulations, games, video, just-in-time learning solutions, job aids and infographics, and animation/motion graphics
* Experience working in the Healthcare industry (preferred)
* Experience developing training modules requiring technical writing/regulatory content
* Proven ability to effectively collaborate, influence and build trusted partnership with People Development Team
* Ability to work in an agile and iterative way in a fast paced and collaborative environment

  


*Sound Physicians is an Equal Employment Opportunity (EEO) employer and is committed to diversity, equity, and inclusion at the bedside and in our workforce. Qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, gender identity, sexual orientation, age, marital status, veteran status, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by federal, state, or local laws.*

  


*This job description reflects the present requirements of the position. As duties and responsibilities change and develop, the job description will be reviewed and subject to amendment.*

title: EDGE SYSTEM ADMINISTRATOR SR, FCH - IT - TECH INFRASTRUCTURE
description:
**Discover. Achieve. Succeed.** **#BeHere**

**Location: US:WI:MENOMONEE FALLS at our WOODLAND PRIME 400 facility.**

**This job is REMOTE.**

**FTE: 1.000000**

**Shift: REMOTE 1st Shift flexible 7 am to 5 pm with an on-call rotation every 3-4 weeks**

 **Job Summary:**

  

Responsible for research, planning, design, build, testing, deployment, troubleshooting, monitoring, and reporting of PCs, Laptops, Mobile Devices, Printers and/or other assigned edge compute devices for Froedtert Health Information Technology. The position is responsible for providing support and input on the direction of the edge compute experience including hardware, software, and environmental evaluation and selection, image maintenance, virtual technologies and capacity planning. As a senior position within the team, work triage, team leadership, and mentoring. Other duties as assigned.

**EXPERIENCE DESCRIPTION:**

Five or more years of experience in Edge Systems Administration or related technologies in use by Froedtert Health such as (but not limited to) Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager (SCCM) for Microsoft Windows Edge Compute Devices, Intune for Apple Edge Compute Devices, etc.


**EDUCATION DESCRIPTION:**

Knowledge of computer, mobility and network principles at a level normally acquired through completion of an Bachelor's degree in a relevant technology field or acquired through a combination of education and experience is required.


**Perks & Benefits at Froedtert Health**

Froedtert Health Offers a variety of perks & benefits to staff, depending on your role you may be eligible for the following:


* Paid time off
* Growth opportunity- Career Pathways & Career Tuition Assistance, CEU opportunities
* Academic Partnership with the Medical College of Wisconsin
* Referral bonuses
* Retirement plan - 403b
* Medical, Dental, Vision, Life Insurance, Short & Long Term Disability, Free Workplace Clinics

Employee Assistance Programs, Adoption Assistance, Healthy Contributions, Care@Work, Moving Assistance, Discounts on gym memberships, travel and other work life benefits available  
* 

  

The Froedtert & the Medical College of Wisconsin regional health network is a partnership between Froedtert Health and the Medical College of Wisconsin supporting a shared mission of patient care, innovation, medical research and education. Our health network operates eastern Wisconsin's only academic medical center and adult Level I Trauma center engaged in thousands of clinical trials and studies. The Froedtert & MCW health network, which includes ten hospitals, nearly 2,000 physicians and more than 45 health centers and clinics draw patients from throughout the Midwest and the nation.

During your application and interview process, if you have a need that requires an accommodation, please contact us at 262-439-1961. We will attempt to fulfill all reasonable accommodation requests.***

title: Network Administrator
description:
**Job Description:**

One of our clients is looking for a Network Administrator. The successful candidate will be responsible for managing our network infrastructure, including network administration, firewall administration, and security reviews and assessments.

**Key Responsibilities:**

* Network Administration: Set up and troubleshoot network issues, manage switches and access points.
* Firewall Administration: Manage Fortinet firewalls, including configuration, maintenance, and troubleshooting.
* Security Reviews and Assessment: Conduct regular security reviews and assessments to identify potential vulnerabilities and implement appropriate solutions.

**Required Skills and Experience:**

* Experience with network setup and troubleshooting
* Familiarity with Fortinet firewalls, switches, and access points
* Strong knowledge of Microsoft Office and Office 365
* Understanding of application APIs

**Education:**

* A bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field is required. Relevant certifications, such as CCNA or CCNP, are highly desirable.

**Experience:**

Pay: $50.00 - $65.00 per hour

Schedule:

Education:

* Bachelor's (Required)

* troubleshoot: 5 years (Required)

title: System Administrator
description:
At Advantive, we make purpose-built software for specialty manufacturing and distribution businesses that streamline complex processes, optimize operations visibility and throughput, and drive improved quality, profitability, and revenue growth. Deeply embedded in our customers’ businesses, Advantive’s software solutions add value along the full manufacturing and distribution lifecycle.



Our customers, who include corrugated and packaging manufacturers, equipment and supply wholesale distributors, and automotive and other specialty manufacturers, benefit from our solutions that have been honed over decades in the marketplace. We know our customers’ businesses intimately and deliver software to address their needs.


**Summary -**

As a System Administrator at Advantive, you'll leverage your technical expertise to administer and optimize IT systems, ensuring their reliability, security, and performance. Your responsibilities will include deploying and configuring system components, monitoring system health, and promptly addressing any issues or anomalies. You'll collaborate with stakeholders to understand their requirements and provide effective solutions, while also documenting processes and procedures for internal reference. Additionally, you'll play a key role in implementing automation solutions, and integrating tools to enhance system efficiency and streamline workflows. Your commitment to operational excellence and adherence to IT best practices will contribute to maintaining a culture of discipline and efficiency within the organization.

  


**Job Description**


**Responsibilities:**


* Administer, maintain, configure, and ensure the reliable operation of a Microsoft 365 tenant serving 500+ end users
* Manage Microsoft Exchange, including configuring mail flow, mailbox management, security settings, and overall support within the Microsoft 365 Exchange Online environment
* Administration of Microsoft SharePoint Online including configuration of security permissions, Site and document library setup, permissions auditing and the general operation and support of Microsoft 365 SharePoint Online
* Utilize scripting and automation to optimize workflow efficiency and enhance system performance within the Microsoft 365 environment
* Deploy, maintain, and configure company-issued personal computers using Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune), encompassing software deployment, patch management, and inventory tracking

 * Manage virtualization technologies such as VMware and Hyper-V
* Maintain and support databases (e.g., SQL Server, MySQL), ensuring data integrity, performance, and security
* Provide documentation and technical specifications to IT staff for planning and implementing new IT systems and infrastructure upgrades
* Oversee backup operations and establish suitable processes for data protection, disaster recovery, and failover procedures
* Provide End users support, including hardware and software troubleshooting, documentation of issues and resolutions, as part of the helpdesk, and ensuring timely resolution of problems with minimal disruptions.


**Qualifications:**


* Associate or bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, System Administration, or a closely related field, or equivalent experience required
* 5+ years of system administration experience
* Exceptional proficiency in Microsoft 365, Azure Active Directory, Exchange, and SharePoint administration
* Advanced expertise in scripting languages and automation
* Proficiency in Microsoft Endpoint Manager (Intune)
* Strong skills in hardware and software troubleshooting, issue documentation, and helpdesk support for end users
* System administration and IT certifications in Microsoft, or other network related fields are a plus


All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.


Qualified applicants will be asked to complete a 30-minute online assessment as a part of your application.

title: IT Network/Server Administrator
description:
### **Company Overview**



Before we opened Strive Pharmacy we were unsatisfied with the current state of the pharmaceutical industry. Most of the current pharmaceuticals only offer a one size fits all approach and often come with unwanted and potentially dangerous side effects. We found that through compounding we can offer a much more personalized solution to medicine.



Through this we have been able to help patients get the results they are seeking for their personal needs. After years of working for corporate chains we took the risk and opened Strive Pharmacy. We are dedicated to providing a better experience for each customer and clinic that we work with. Come see the Strive difference.


### **Our Mission**


**We're flipping the script with personal medicine.** We strive to interrupt an industry that has been closed to personalized care, accessibility, and nuance for too long. We strive to shift a reactive view of self-care and ignite a proactive baseline-shifting approach to health for all. 'The human element' is our crux and catalyst, driving all that we do, whether we're interacting with patients, providers, or practices. We're here to partner with those ready for a change. More than a compounding pharmacy, we're on a mission to positively disrupt healthcare as we know it. Strive is about more than medicine. Strive is about striving for the personal side of healthcare.

**This is a 100% remote position. Our corporate office is based in Gilbert, AZ.**


**Position Overview**



Strive Pharmacy is seeking a skilled **IT Network/Server Administrator** to join our team. This role is crucial for ensuring the stable operation of our IT networking infrastructure. The IT Network/Server Administrator will be responsible for the design, implementation, and maintenance of networked systems, including local area networks (LANs), wide area networks (WANs), network segments, and other communication networks. This position requires a deep understanding of network hardware, software, and network management best practices, with a strong emphasis on security and efficient operation. The ideal candidate will have significant experience with Linux systems and a familiarity with Berkeley Software Distribution (BSD) as a preferred skill.  

  

**Key Responsibilities:**


* Collaborate with department heads to assess network capacity needs for the short and long term.
* Design, deploy, and manage LANs, WANs, and wireless networks, ensuring high availability and performance.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation related to network configuration, mapping, processes, and service records.
* Develop and implement network policies, procedures, and disaster recovery plans.
* Research and recommend network products, services, and standards.
* Oversee the installation, configuration, and upgrade of network hardware and software.
* Configure and maintain network connectivity for servers, workstations, telephony equipment, and other network appliances.
* Manage network security solutions, perform security audits, and ensure data privacy compliance.
* Provide backup support for Helpdesk on level two tickets and overflow calls.


**Required Qualifications:**


* 5-7 years of experience with LAN, WAN, WLAN, WWAN design, and implementation.
* Strong knowledge of network capacity planning, security principles, and management best practices.
* Experience with VOIP phone systems and network security devices.
* Competency in setting up and configuring firewalls.
* Excellent hardware troubleshooting skills.

title: Linux System Administrator
description:
**Linux System Administrator**

 **Job Location: 100% Remote**

 **Job Description:**


As a Linux systems administrator, you will manage, build, and troubleshoot physical and virtual servers using Red Hat Linux Operating Systems. Perform administrative operations and maintenance functions of linux server hardware and software. You will be responsible for deployment, configuration, and life cycle management of the Linux platforms. You will provide support for system hardening to DOD security standards.


An understanding of DoD and government security standards and policies are needed to ensure all deployed changes are highly secure and available.

**Qualifications:**

* 7+ years of systems administration experience working in an enterprise environment (DOD environment highly preferred).
* 5+ years of experience with Red Hat Linux systems administration and maintenance.
* Hands on experience with system hardening and implementation of DISA STIGs.
* Ability to work with stakeholders including management and development teams in defining requirements.
* Capable of interpreting vulnerability reports and defining executable actions that should be taken to reduce vulnerabilities and risks with proven ability to perform in-depth analysis on patch requirements, migrations in Linux environments, and build an action plan that will address vulnerabilities.
* Familiarity with VMWare and SAN management and concepts

**Typical Duties/Abilities:**

* Active Directory domain administration to include Group Policy deployment, management, and troubleshooting.
* Maintain system documentation and develop new documentation for system configurations, procedures, and best practices.
* Analyze and monitor system performance and capacity, proactively identifying and resolving issues.
* Validating and implementing critical system patches.
* Create, deploy, and administer file servers and shares for functionality in hybrid environments.
* Assist with network troubleshooting and resolutions on LAN and WAN connections.
* Assists with the scheduling, planning, and oversight of system upgrades.
* Assists in planning upgrades and replacements for program assets upon reaching their end-of-life cycle.
* Supports requirements gathering and asset acquisition for new programs of work.
* Supports team leadership as required and ensures customer requirements and project milestones are met.

**Soft Skills**

* Experience working with Agile methodologies (Scrum, Lean Startup, XP) and cross-functional teams (Product Owners, Scrum Masters, Developers, Designers, Business Analysts)
* Strong communication and collaboration skills with a track record of taking solution ownership.
* Communication skills key! Demonstrate an ability to effectively communicate with leadership and key stakeholders.
* Ability to articulate design and configuration choices and bring about consensus.

**Education/Certifications:**

* BS degree in Information Technology or another related technical discipline.

title: Network Administrator II (6:45 AM – 7 PM Thursday – Saturday, every other Wednesday)
description:
**Overview**


**Work Where it Matters**


SAVA, an Akima company, is not just another global services contractor. As an Alaska Native Corporation (ANC), our mission and purpose extend beyond our exciting federal projects as we support our shareholder communities in Alaska.


At SAVA, the work you do every day makes a difference in the lives of our 15,000 Iñupiat shareholders, a group of Alaska natives from one of the most remote and harshest environments in the United States.


**For our shareholders** , SAVA provides support and employment opportunities and contributes to the survival of a culture that has thrived above the Arctic Circle for more than 10,000 years.


**For our government customers** , SAVA delivers global solutions that enhance business processes, lower costs, and take on today’s missions with greater opportunity, agility, and strength.


**As a SAVA employee** , you will be surrounded by a challenging, yet supportive work environment that is committed to innovation and diversity, two of our most important values. You will also have access to our comprehensive benefits and competitive pay in addition to growth opportunities and excellent retirement options.


**Job Summary:**


SAVA is looking to fill critical Information Technology based positions for our customer with the United States Coast Guard. The ideal candidate will possess the following qualities: outstanding customer service, expertise/knowledge in the required field, a strong work ethic and dedication to the Coast Guard’s mission.


The Network Administrator II analyzes network characteristics such as traffic, connect time, transmission speeds, packet sizes, and throughput.


The Network Administrator II assists more senior network engineers with the installation, removal and modifications to network components.


The Network Administrator II supports more senior network engineers with user support and third-party vendors.


Provides Tier I/II support for one-year project to migrate U.S. Coast Guard (USCG) Cisco routers from existing Verizon circuits to AT&T circuits.


The ideal candidate will be able to support a rotating shift schedule.


100% Remote.
Shift Schedule: 6:45 AM – 7 PM Thursday – Saturday, every other Wednesday.


**Responsibilities**


**Job Responsibilities:**


* Provide ongoing network support, addresses availability issues, overcomes performance problems and provides overall level 2 support.
* Manage network performance, diagnoses performance problems and undertakes tuning activities to ensure network performance meets Service Level Agreement requirements.
* Troubleshoot and resolve problems to ensure quality transmission service on the network.
* Report on overall network performance including frequent problems, underlying issues and plans to improve network availability, performance, and problem resolution.
* Implement and coordinates network policies, procedures, and standards.
* Enforce network security procedures.
* Work under general supervision, providing solutions to technical problems of moderate scope/complexity.
* Interpret alerts generated by monitoring systems.
* Monitor the network stability and performance in order to maintain continual operations.
* Coordinate communication between the various groups.
* Proactive incident and problem ticket creation based on event log and performance measures.

**Qualifications**


**Minimum Qualifications:**


* Active DOD Secret Clearance
* 2-4 years of experience, MS 1 year plus of network management experience and IT experience
* WAN troubleshooting/problem determination skills (ISDN, ATM, SONET, etc.)
* Experience with various types of infrastructure equipment (Cisco, Juniper)
* Knowledge of network analysis tools (Cisco Prime, SolarWinds, Identity Services Engine, Cisco Adaptive Security Device Manager, etc.)
* On the job experience with hardware and software configuration management
* Outstanding customer service

**Desired Skills:**


* Cisco Certified Network Associate/Professional (CCNA/CCNP) desired
* Microsoft Technology Associate certification desired
* Bachelor’s degree in information technology field

We are an equal opportunity employer and comply with all applicable federal, state, and local fair employment practices laws. All applicants will receive consideration for employment, without regard to race, color, religion, creed, national origin, gender or gender-identity, age, marital status, sexual orientation, veteran status, disability, pregnancy or parental status, or any other basis prohibited by law. If you are an individual with a disability, or have known limitations related to pregnancy, childbirth, or related medical conditions, and would like to request a reasonable accommodation for any part of the employment process, please contact us at job-assist@akima.com or 571-353-7053 (information about job applications status is not available at this contact information).


**Job:** Information Technology


**Travel:** None


**Organization:** SAVA


**Clearance:** SECRET


**Work Type:** Remote


**Remote:** Yes


**ReqID:** 2024-7838

title: OKTA Systems Administrator
description:
**OKTA Systems Administrator**

USA – Remote  



**Who We Are**

RL Canning is a global IT managed service and consultancy dedicated to working alongside our customers to enhance the digital workplace with a clear focus on value by maximizing technology and operational excellence. Our service portfolio and ecosystem of digital innovators offer industry-leading solutions and integrated expertise that are designed with each unique customer in mind to deliver a sustained effort to achieve better and faster results that are aligned to enduring strategic outcomes.  



**Job Overview**

The **OKTA Systems Administrator** is responsible for the administration, configuration, monitoring support, and maintenance of a broad range of network, server, application, data storage, media, and computing devices related to delivering IT services to meet the needs of the business. This role takes full responsibility for administrative activities related to systems and ensures that optimum performance and availability essential to business operations are maintained.  



**In this role, you will**

* Administration, configuration, monitoring, support, and maintenance of a new product line implementation.
* Maintaining knowledge of a broad range of servers, applications, data storage, media, and computing devices related to delivering IT services to assist with the overflow of work being performed by the client support team.
* Responsible for specialized product configuration, user administration, security, workflow, data management, and integrations for OKTA application and dependent applications and systems.
* Responsible for specialized product configuration, user administration, security, workflow, data management, and integrations for SailPoint applications and dependent applications and systems.
* Perform administrative activities related to systems and ensure that optimum performance and availability essential to business operations are maintained.
* Coordination with project advocates on the development of user manuals, training materials, and other documents as needed to enable successful implementation and turnover of the process to the client.
* Assisting with going forward with best practices for utilization of the implemented technology tool.
* Monitor system activities and performance to determine the operational condition of systems, including utilization, capacity, transactions, load, traffic, errors, events, and alerts.
* Analyze, troubleshoot, and diagnose complex systems-related problems to determine priority, response, resolution, or escalation required related to impact on business operations.
* Perform administrative and technical procedures for implementing changes, modifications, upgrades, additions, and deletions to systems components related to hardware, operating systems, applications, and software.
* Plan and coordinate installations, modifications, and upgrades with team members and business leaders to minimize downtime and maximize performance for the business.
* Perform systems testing to ensure systems configuration, changes, and conditions are in accordance with operating policy, standards, procedures, and revisions.
* Apply change management techniques and methods to support the integration, adoption, and utilization of technology resources.
* Assist with facilitating communications, scheduling, and business requirements.
* Develop system documentation and administrator training material to assist in hand-off after products are implemented.
* Other duties as assigned.

**For this role, you will need**

* 3+ years of server administration, maintenance, and support experience is required.
* Must have OKTA Identity Management solutions experience.
* Microsoft Windows Server Platforms experience.
* Active Directory, Group Policy, Exchange experience.
* Microsoft PowerShell scripting experience.
* Support of Cloud products including Office 365 experience.
* Ability to travel.

**Why Join Us**

**Cutting-Edge Innovation & Technology:** Unlock the opportunity to be a vital part of a cutting-edge environment where innovation is not just encouraged but is a way of life. You’ll have the opportunity to engage with the latest technologies, contribute to groundbreaking projects, and be at the forefront of technological advancements in the IT sector.  



**Professional and Personal Growth:** Our company believes in investing in our team’s growth. Our commitment is to empower our team members with the tools and resources they need to enhance their skills, stay at the forefront of industry trends, and unlock new opportunities for advancement. We believe that investing in the development of our talent not only enriches individual careers but also contributes to the collective success of our company.  



**Collaborative & Inclusive Culture:** Become part of a team where collaboration is key. Our inclusive culture values every voice and fosters a workspace where teamwork and collective problem-solving are paramount. You’ll work alongside talented professionals from diverse backgrounds, sharing ideas and creating solutions together.  



**Empowering Work Environment:** Discover the opportunity to be a valued team member where your ideas are valued, your contributions matter, and your potential is recognized. You will be part of a team where your ideas are heard and your work has a meaningful impact on our projects and clients, fostering a sense of achievement and purpose in your role.  



**Benefits Offered**

· Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance


· Matching 401K


· Short & Long-Term Disability


· Life Insurance


· Paid Holidays


· Paid Time Off  



*\\*\\* RL Canning is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All applicants will be afforded equal opportunity without discrimination because of race, color, religion, sex, marital status, national origin or ancestry, age, physical or mental handicap unrelated to ability, or an unfavorable discharge from military service.*

title: System Administrator
description:
**About us**

Thank you for considering employment opportunities with SoftOrbits. We kindly request that you refrain from submitting job applications via Indeed, as we are currently inundated with a high volume of messages through this platform, making it difficult to process them efficiently.

* Administer and maintain network infrastructure, including both Windows and Linux systems, ensuring their reliability, security, and performance.
* Configure, install, and manage network hardware and software components, such as routers, switches, firewalls, and servers, to support organizational requirements.
* Monitor network activity, analyze performance data, and troubleshoot issues to identify and resolve network-related problems in a timely manner.

title: Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator
description:
**Who We Are**

LeMans Corporation, the leading global distributor of motorcycle, snowmobile, ATV/UTV and personal watercraft parts and accessories headquartered in Janesville, Wisconsin has an immediate opening for a Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator.

LeMans Corporation promotes racing through its campaign WE SUPPORT THE SPORT®, helping to drive consumers to dealerships, while entertaining its dealers through hospitalities at the events it sponsors. LeMans Corporation d/b/a Parts Unlimited and Drag Specialties sells to over 20,000 dealerships worldwide. We continue to expand our service territory with our sister companies, Parts Canada, and Parts Europe.

**Overview**

The Dynamics 365 F&O Junior System Administrator assists the Senior System Administrator with monitoring D365 environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds. This position performs D365 custom code deployments and other day to day system maintenance and administration of D365 as directed.

**Essential Functions**

* Performs D365 custom code deployments
* Assists Senior System Administrator with deployment of Microsoft scheduled releases
* Monitors & debugs Logic Apps to ensure integrations are functioning as expected
* Implements D365 security configurations to stay in line with Microsoft’s best practices to ensure highly available and secure environments
* Monitors the D365 environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds
* Monitors and collaborates on issues related to the D365 system
* Available during work hours through company’s communication channels: Outlook, Slack, Microsoft Teams
* Maintains strict confidentiality
* Performs other tasks and/or duties as assigned

**Non-Essential Functions**

* Performs Azure changes in conjunction with the Network support team that are impactful to D365
* Implements Azure security configurations to stay in line with Microsoft’s best practices to ensure highly available and secure environments
* Monitors the Azure environments to ensure they are operating within expected bounds

**Required Qualifications and Education**

* Associates Degree required with a DevOps/Cloud computing focus preferred
* **1 or more of the following:**
* Microsoft Certificates: D365 Fundamentals (ERP), F&O Apps Dev Associate, or Finance Functional Consultant Associate
* Microsoft Certified Professional (MCP) Azure
* Strong working knowledge of Microsoft Dynamics 365 systems/functional capabilities ​
* 1+ years of hands-on operational experience supporting Dynamics AX or D365 F&O ERP
* 2+ years of experience in building, monitoring, and maintaining Azure cloud environments
* Good working knowledge of MS tools such as Azure DevOps, Lifecycle Services, and Visual Studio

Reasonable accommodations can be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

* Must be able to remain in a stationary position 7+ hours

title: Security Administrator
description:
**Position Mission**



The Security Administrator is responsible and accountable for oversight, design, and management of the Parasol Managed Security program. This role will ensure that Parasol MSSP clients receive all contracted security services in line with the promised schedule. Contracted Security services currently include end user awareness testing and training, penetration testing, and HIPAA security auditing. This position works closely with other departments to ensure security standards are met, both internally and in client environments.


**Responsibilities**



* Management and delivery of the primary Managed Security Services provided to all MSSP clients
* Developing and maintaining comprehensive policies and procedures relating to the Managed Security program
* Initial research and response planning for newly discovered vulnerabilities that could potentially impact multiple clients
* This includes delegating tasks and deadlines to respective departments to ensure the response plan is met
* Working closely with other departments to establish or update current security standards
* This role will be responsible for ensuring all standards are documented and centrally available.
* Each department is primarily responsible for their own standards; however, this role will have input and the ability to suggest adds or changes as necessary.
* Routine auditing to ensure security standards are in place as defined by the respective departments
* This role is responsible for creating the audit schedule and delegating tasks and deadlines to other departments to ensure the audits get completed in line with the schedule.
* Working closely with other departments on vulnerability resolution plans based on results received from MSSP services



**Requirements**



* Healthcare experience preferred; long-term healthcare support experience is a plus.
* At least 5 years of systems or network administration experience in an enterprise environment.
* At least 5 years’ experience working with systems or network design, configuration, and management with a focus on security
* Experience with multiple enterprise or network systems or technologies such as Active Directory, Microsoft Server, Windows Operating Systems, file shares, printers and copiers, phone systems, Exchange, routers, switches, firewalls, routing, VPN, desktop hardware support, network support, application support, etc.
* Excellent communication and customer service skills are required.
* The position is largely self-motivated and self-structured. The right candidate will be driven to be challenged and to succeed.

title: IT Systems Administrator
description:
**Summary**  

 Idera, Inc. brands deliver best-in-class B2B software tools for testing, security, data management and application development. Idera is seeking an experienced **IT Systems Administrator** to be responsible for the implementation and operational support of all aspects of Idera’s physical and virtualized infrastructure. This infrastructure supports servers, desktops, terminal servers, networks, application virtualization and storage. A successful candidate will possess a solid understanding of virtualization products, various cloud platforms and networking fundamentals to be able to troubleshoot and resolve software, hardware, network configuration and operational problems across the IT infrastructure. Knowledge of multiple vendor technologies and platforms, including VMware, Microsoft, IBM, AWS, GCP, Unix, iOS and Cisco, is required.  

  

**Primary Responsibilities:*** Build, install, configure and maintain VMware products, including ESXi, across cloud platforms including AWS, GCP and Azure
* Provide advanced troubleshooting and problem resolution of the entire IT infrastructure
* Research the root cause of problems and collaborate across functions to provide solutions
* Develop, automate and implement IT operations best practices
* Perform Capacity Management functions
* Effectively collaborate with Server, Storage, Network, Data Center, Facilities, Audit, Compliance, PMO, and DevOps teams
* Proactively implement advanced maintenance and resolve issues related to performance cloud environments
* Troubleshoot common network protocols across various cloud platforms
* Configure and maintain storage infrastructure, ensuring optimal availability, performance and best practices
* Manage problem and service tickets to ensure timely resolution and meet internal service level agreements
* Follow established enterprise change management procedures
* Participate in Business Continuation and Disaster Recovery infrastructure planning, building, and testing
* Must have the ability to understand and relate to new products, technology, strategy
* Must be able to provide project management that includes planning, documentation, meetings, conference calls and reporting.
* Ability to conduct training sessions to share knowledge with peers and other support teams is necessary

title: Systems Administrator, Junior
description:
Systems Administrator, Junior**The Opportunity:**


Your combination of people skills and system administrator expertise makes you the team hero, solving one problem after another. What if you could use those skills to improve the technology supporting our team, clients, and mission? We’re looking for a system administrator who is fluent in Windows Server Administration, basic networking knowledge, and exhibits strong communication skills to help us further enhance our remote development lab capabilities.


As a system administrator on our team, you’ll facilitate account setup and management, system configuration management, and security best-practice implementation. You’ll learn how to help clients overcome challenges through monitoring and performance management. You’ll analyze problem areas and opportunities for improvement in a mission-critical network.


You’ll combine your technical knowledge and communication skills to turn metrics into information and articulate their meaning. This is an opportunity to gain experience with VMWare Horizon and enhance Scripting and Automation to foster the automation of routine tasks and to help streamline processes. We focus on growing as a team, so we’ll share techniques, work through challenges, and develop new methodologies together. Work with us and resolve daily challenges as we improve the remote lab capabilities.


Join us. The world can’t wait.

**You Have:**

* Experience in Windows Server Administration, configuring and managing Windows Server operating systems
* Experience with Active Directory, including setting up and managing domain controllers
* Experience with security concepts and best practices, including user permissions, access controls, and encryption
* Knowledge of setting up and managing file shares on Windows servers
* Knowledge of Group Policy management for configuring and controlling user and computer settings
* Knowledge of backup strategies and recovery procedures for both Windows servers and virtual machines
* Knowledge of tools and techniques for monitoring system performance and making necessary optimizations
* Ability to deploy, configure, and manage virtual machines using VMware vSphere
* Ability to obtain a security clearance
* HS diploma or GED

**Nice If You Have:**

* Experience with VMware Horizon for virtual desktop infrastructure (VDI) setup and management
* Experience with Scripting and Automation tools, including PowerShell, to automate routine tasks and streamline processes
* Ability to diagnose and resolve issues related to Windows servers and VMware infrastructure
* Possession of excellent oral and written communication skills for collaborating with team members, documenting processes, and providing support
* Bachelor's degree in Engineering, Computer Science, Mathematics, or Physical Science

**Clearance:**

Applicants selected will be subject to a security investigation and may need to meet eligibility requirements for access to classified information.

**Create Your Career:**

**Grow With Us**


Your growth matters to us—that’s why we offer a variety of ways for you to develop your career. With professional and leadership development opportunities like upskilling programs, tuition reimbursement, mentoring, and firm-sponsored networking, you can chart a unique and fulfilling career path on your own terms.

**A Place Where You Belong**


Diverse perspectives cultivate collective ingenuity. Booz Allen’s culture of respect, equity, and opportunity means that, here, you are free to bring your whole self to work. With an array of business resource groups and other opportunities for connection, you’ll build your community in no time.

**Support Your Well-Being**


Our comprehensive benefits package includes wellness programs with HSA contributions, paid holidays, paid parental leave, a generous 401(k) match, and more. With these benefits, plus the option for flexible schedules and remote and hybrid locations, we’ll support you as you pursue a balanced, fulfilling life—at work and at home.

**Your Candidate Journey**


At Booz Allen, we know our people are what propel us forward, and we value relationships most of all. Here, we’ve compiled a list of resources so you’ll know what to expect as we forge a connection with you during your journey as a candidate with us.

**Compensation**


At Booz Allen, we celebrate your contributions, provide you with opportunities and choices, and support your total well-being. Our offerings include health, life, disability, financial, and retirement benefits, as well as paid leave, professional development, tuition assistance, work-life programs, and dependent care. Our recognition awards program acknowledges employees for exceptional performance and superior demonstration of our values. Full-time and part-time employees working at least 20 hours a week on a regular basis are eligible to participate in Booz Allen’s benefit programs. Individuals that do not meet the threshold are only eligible for select offerings, not inclusive of health benefits. We encourage you to learn more about our total benefits by visiting the Resource page on our Careers site and reviewing Our Employee Benefits page.


Salary at Booz Allen is determined by various factors, including but not limited to location, the individual’s particular combination of education, knowledge, skills, competencies, and experience, as well as contract-specific affordability and organizational requirements. The projected compensation range for this position is $49,900.00 to $102,000.00 (annualized USD). The estimate displayed represents the typical salary range for this position and is just one component of Booz Allen’s total compensation package for employees. This posting will close within 90 days from the Posting Date.**Work Model**  

Our people-first culture prioritizes the benefits of flexibility and collaboration, whether that happens in person or remotely.

* If this position is listed as remote or hybrid, you’ll periodically work from a Booz Allen or client site facility.
* If this position is listed as onsite, you’ll work with colleagues and clients in person, as needed for the specific role.

**EEO Commitment**


We’re an equal employment opportunity/affirmative action employer that empowers our people to fearlessly drive change – no matter their race, color, ethnicity, religion, sex (including pregnancy, childbirth, lactation, or related medical conditions), national origin, ancestry, age, marital status, sexual orientation, gender identity and expression, disability, veteran status, military or uniformed service member status, genetic information, or any other status protected by applicable federal, state, local, or international law.

title: Specialist, Provider Network Admin - Remote (NV)
description:

Provider Network Administration is responsible for the accurate and timely validation and maintenance of critical provider information on all claims and provider databases. Staff ensure adherence to business and system requirements of internal customers as it pertains to other provider network management areas, such as provider contracts.
  
  

KNOWLEDGE/SKILLS/ABILITIES
  
  

Oversees receipt of and coordinates data from the provider network for entry into the plan's provider management system.
  
  

Reviews/analyzes data by applying job knowledge and experience to ensure appropriate information has been provided.
  
  

Audits loaded provider records for quality and financial accuracy and provides documented feedback.
  
  

Assists in configuration issues with Corporate team members.
  
  

Assists in training current staff and new hires as necessary.
  
  

Conducts or participates in special projects as requested.
  
  

JOB QUALIFICATIONS
  
  

Required Education
  
  

Associate degree in Business or equivalent combination of education and experience
  
  

Required Experience
  
  

Min. 3 years managed care experience
  
  

**Experience in one or more of the following:** Claims, Provider Services, Provider Network Operations, Hospital or Physician Billing, or similar.
  
  

Claims processing background including coordination of benefits, subrogation, and/or eligibility criteria.
  
  

Preferred Education
  
  

Bachelor's Degree
  
  

Preferred Experience
  
  

3+ years Provider Claims and/or Provider Network Administration experience
  
  

Experience in Medical Terminology, CPT, ICD-9 codes, etc.
  
  

Access and Excel – intermediate skill level (or higher)

title: Network Administrator
company: Community Blood Center Of Greater Kansas City
description:
Overview:
**Make a difference, save a life! Great career ladder opportunities. $1000 sign-on bonus.**  

We are seeking a skilled and detail-oriented Network Administrator to join our dynamic IT team. The ideal candidate will play a crucial role in maintaining the integrity and security of our organization's network infrastructure. The Network Administrator will be responsible for implementing, supporting, and managing our network systems to ensure optimal performance and availability.  

Annual compensation rate starting at $65,000.
Responsibilities:
**Primary Duties, Responsibilities or Activities Required by Job:**
1. **Network Implementation & Support:*** Implement, support and maintain the organization's network infrastructure.
* Participate in hardware and software evaluations to meet the rganization's current and future network infrastructure requirements.


2. **Network Security:*** Support and manage security measures under the direction from Information Security Team to protect the network from unauthorized access, attacks, and data breaches.
* Monitor network traffic for unusual activity and escalate security issues.

**3.** **Server Support****:*** Maintain server OS updates and other infrastructure related appliances and applications.
* Troubleshooting end user issues connecting to servers.
* File recovery for end users and servers.


4. **Network Maintenance and Troubleshooting:*** Diagnose and resolve network issues promptly, minimizing downtime and ensuring uninterrupted business operations (e.g., WAN, LAN, WiFi).
* Perform regular maintenance and support tasks to ensure the smooth operation of the network infrastructure including support for telephone systems and security cameras.


5. **User Support:*** Participate as third tier escalation point to provide end-user support related to network connectivity and infrastructure issues.
* Collaborate with other IT professionals to address and resolve user- reported problems.
* Participate in after-hours on-call rotation to provide operational support.


6. **Documentation:*** Maintain accurate and up-to-date documentation of network configurations, procedures, and policies.
* Develop and update documentation for changes to inventory and configuration of network infrastructure.


7. **Performance Monitoring and Optimization:*** Monitor network performance and identify opportunities for improvement.
* Work with Network Engineers on server patching and maintenance.
* Review logs for patch management, Backups, and other events on network devices.
* Organization of network cabling and maintaining standards on cabling for network closets and rooms.


8. **Collaboration and Communication:*** Collaborate with other IT teams, departments, and external vendors to coordinate network-related activities.
* Communicate network changes and maintenance schedules to relevant process stakeholders.

  

**Other Secondary Functions:*** Prepare various reports.
* Attends conferences, seminars, as required.
* Makes recommendations to improve business unit practices and processes.
* Any related duties as assigned.
  


Qualifications:
**Education:**
Bachelor’s degree in information technology, Computer Science, or a related field. **Related Experience:**
Two years’ experience as a Network Administrator or similar role.  

Experience with network monitoring tools.  

Any combination of education, training and experience equivalent to the requirements above that has supplied the necessary knowledge, skills, and experience to perform the essential functions of the job. **Required Licenses / Certification:**
CompTIA A+ preferred
Cisco Certified Network Associate (CCNA) preferred.  

Knowledge:  

Knowledge of networking protocols, security principles, and best practices.  

Knowledge of Citrix, RemoteApp, SQL, IIS, load balancers, SonicWall firewalls, NAP, Cisco ISE, Veeam Backup.  

Skills:
Proficiency with Cisco and Meraki routers, switches, firewalls, access points and other networking equipment.  

Proficient in Windows Server OS, Linux, Windows OS, Active Directory.  

Cultural competency and the ability to communicate effectively in a culturally sensitive manner with both individuals and groups from diverse backgrounds.  

Abilities  

Excellent troubleshooting and problem-solving skills.  

Strong communication and interpersonal skills.

description:

title: Senior M365 Tier 2 Application Administrator
description:
Provide Microsoft 365 (M365) core program oversight and support Program Management Office activities at the Enterprise level across the Internal Revenue Service (IRS), which consists of 28 Business Units (BUs) and Information Technology (IT) Organizations. M365 enterprise is a cloud-powered productivity platform that preserves and shares information across the IRS using MS Exchange Servers, MS Teams, OneDrive for Business (ODB), SharePoint Online (SPO), Project Online (PJO), and Power Platforms (PP) tools.
The Increase Reduction Act New Hire (IRA-NH) signed by Congress August 16, 2022, mandates the IRS to improve the taxpayer experience and compliance. This M365 task order will ensure that the M365 tools are in place to provide the taxpayers with the ability to navigate the IRS systems with ease and to ensure taxpayer compliance.  

Job Description:
The Contractor shall provide Tier 2 Application Administration to the M365 Applications for the M365 business cloud systems and applications. Oversee and execute tasks pertaining to the maintenance and administration of the IRS Enterprise.  

Job Requirements:* Provide technical support and effective solutions for M365 applications.
* Troubleshoot and resolve complex M365 issues in a timely manner.
* Prioritize and adjust to meet workload requirements.
* Follow established IRS policies and procedures to deliver services.
* Research and respond to customer concerns and inquiries relating to M365 applications.
* Collaborate with engineering and other team members to clearly identify, document, and resolve reoccurring M365 technical issues and provide feedback on product enhancements and improvements.
* Provide bi-weekly status reports that encompasses schedule, M365 deliverables for each tool, action items, risks, mitigations, escalations, accomplishments, and closures.

Desired Outcome:
The Contractor shall provide successful Senior Tier 2 M365 support to the M365 Program Management Office (PMO) to ensure timely completion of activities and projects.  

Job Skill Requirements:* Contractor shall have a minimum 5 years’ experience supporting Microsoft 365 (M365) Cloud Based Suite in a large corporate/government environment.
* Contractor shall have excellent verbal and written communication skills, including the ability to explain technologies and technical business concepts to multiple audiences.
* Contractor shall establish and maintain effective business unit relationships.

We are an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Constellation West will not discharge or, in any other manner, discriminate against employees or applicants because they have inquired about, discussed, or disclosed their own pay or the pay of another employee or applicant. However, employees who have access to the compensation information of other employees or applicants as a part of their essential job functions cannot disclose the pay of other employees or applicants to individuals who do not otherwise have access to compensation information unless the disclosure is (a) in response to a formal complaint or charge, (b) in furtherance of an investigation, proceeding, hearing, or action, including an investigation conducted by the employer, or (c) consistent with the contractor’s legal duty to furnish information. 41 CFR 60-1.35(c)
About the Organization
Constellation West is an award winning company that delivers Information Technology (IT) engineering services and solutions along with non-IT subject matter expertise world-wide. Established in 1997, Constellation West continues as an industry leader, partnering with key organizations. As a prime contractor or preferred subcontractor, we have a continual list of opportunities to fill across the nation with multiple agencies such as the Department of Veteran Affairs, Department of Defense, civilian agencies, and national intelligence community. Many of the positions supporting U.S. federal government require our employees be granted security clearances.
Constellation West provides fully integrated solutions spanning all aspects of system/network engineering, system/network administration, data management, information assurance, quality assurance, full lifecycle support, software development, and geospatial information services. Constellation West looks for the right people ready to step up and be part of a dynamic team.
If you are looking for a new challenge and a rewarding opportunity to apply your expertise, knowledge, and problem solving skills, come join our team! Constellation West offers competitive salary and benefits including:* Tuition reimbursement
* Competitive 401(k) plan
* Competitive Health Benefits
* 11 Paid Holidays!!
* 15 PTO Days!
* Veteran Hiring Preference

title: Network Analyst II
description:
*Agile Defense provides leading-edge Digital Transformation solutions to support and advance our customers' mission. We deliver innovative and high-quality services to our customers worldwide through an empowered and engaged workforce.* **Requisition #:** 20 **Job Title:** Network Analyst II **Location:** Ashburn, VA **(Remote)** **Clearance Level:** Active CBP Suitability, DHS Suitability, Active TS **Salary Range:** $49,260 - $73,890
**SUMMARY**
Customs Border Patrol (CBP) has a global presence with connectivity to approximately 1300 field sites as well as Other Government Agencies (OGAs) and trade partners. CBP conducts operations in 22 countries, 328 ports of entry, 129 border patrol stations within 22 sectors, and 75 AMO locations. To support its mission, CBP needs a robust, resilient, and high performing enterprise network and supporting services throughout its global footprint. The Network Services Division within the Office of Information and Technology (OIT) Enterprise Infrastructure and Operations Directorate (EIOD) provides network services and oversight of the CBP enterprise network infrastructure and comprises the Network Architecture and Engineering Division (NAED) and Network Operations Division (NOD).
The Network Analyst II provides direct support to the Senior Mobility Engineer with Mobile Device Management (MDM) user support and issue resolution. Candidate should have working experience in supporting Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and MDM solutions at large scale Enterprise customers with proven delivery in supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting “complex” AirWatch or equivalent MDM systems. The Network Analyst II (Mobility Support) supports the Solutions Architect with design and implementation tasks and address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues. **JOB DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES**
Provide system administration of Enterprise Mobility Management (EMM) and Mobile Device management (MDM) solutions
Support, maintain and troubleshoot AirWatch systems
Support the design and implementation of simple MDM solutions
Support escalation and root cause analysis activities
Support of all updates to all documents when there is change in the transport design and/or technologies and collaborating with all stakeholders to test all related systems and processes to verify that the systems meet requirements and can host applications with no degradation to performance or security
Address client queries over the phone and resolve mobile device related issues
Work with the Solution Architect to implement solutions
Provide network administration support: firewalls, general network infrastructure and security fundamentals, VPN, DNS
Follow and perform ITIL Incident, problem and requirements management
Develop and implement test strategies and documents results
Provides documentation, guidance and training to end-users as needed
Receive mentoring for MDM Airwatch solutions design and implementation by solutions architect
Responsible for the preparation of test reports and Implementation Plans for each change impacting the Production environment **QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Certifications**
Eligibility/Clearance Requirements: Must be a U.S. Citizen with an active clearance.
Clearance Preference:
CBP Full BI - 1st priority
Any DHS badge + DoD Top Secret - 2nd choice
DoD Top Secret + willingness to get CBP clearance - 3rd choice (it can take 45 days to 6 months to obtain a CBP clearance – work can only begin once the clearance is fully adjudicated) **Education, Background, and Years of Experience**
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Engineering, IT Systems, or other related discipline. Education requirement may be substituted with an additional 4 years of relevant experience.
2-4 years’ work experience as a System Administrator – supporting, maintaining and troubleshooting MDM systems AND Smart Devices (Apple, Android devices like tablet and smart phone, Windows iOS, etc. **ADDITIONAL SKILLS & QUALIFICATIONS** **Required Skills**
Experience with firewalls, VPN, DNS and general network and network security infrastructure
Strong understanding of servers & configuration & maintenance: Windows Server 2008 / 2003 / 2013, Exchange, 0365, Azure AD, Active Directory, Web server platforms (IIS, Apache), Linux Forms (Ubuntu, Fedora, RedHat, Photon, Open Suse), other mail systems, web certifications such as SSL and IIS
Strong knowledge of ITIL based Service Management workflow applications such as incident, problem, and requirements management: Authentication, Certificate system, etc.
Technical Certifications or demonstrable experience in in one or more MDM Products (AirWatch, MobileIron, XenMobile, Symantec MDM, Good Tech)
Seeking candidate who can mentor, teach and grow a small team from within to support growing customer requirements.
Must have great communication and documentation skills.
Must be able to work with minimal supervision and possess excellent written and verbal communication skills. **WORKING CONDITIONS** **Environmental Conditions**
Fully Remote (Must be within a 4 hour driving distance from the NCR).  

  

**Strength Demands**
Medium – 50 lbs. Maximum lifting with frequent lift/carry up to 25 lbs. **Physical Requirements**
Stand or Sit; Walk; Repetitive Motion; Use Hands / Fingers to Handle or Feel; Stoop, Kneel, Crouch, or Crawl; See; Push or Pull; Climb (stairs, ladders) or Balance (ascend / descend, work atop, traverse).
*Employees of Agile Defense are our number one priority, and the importance we place on our culture here is fundamental. Our culture is alive and evolving, but it always stays true to its roots. Here, you are valued as a family member, and we believe that we can accomplish great things together. Agile Defense has been highly successful in the past few years due to our employees and the culture we create together. We believe several attributes are the root of our very best employees and extraordinary culture. We have named these attributes “The 6 H’s” – Happy, Helpful, Honest, Humble, Hungry, and Hustle.*  

***Happy****: We exhibit a positive outlook in order to create a positive environment.****Helpful****: We assist each other and pull together as teammates to deliver.****Honest****: We conduct our business with integrity.****Humble****: We recognize that success is not achieved alone, that there is always more to learn, and that no task is below us.****Hungry****: We desire to consistently improve.****Hustle****: We work hard and get after it.* *These Core Values are present in all our employees and our organization's aspects. Learn more about us and our culture by visiting us* *here.* ***COVID-19 Vaccination Requirements****Agile Defense is subject to federal vaccine mandates or other customer/facility vaccination requirements as a federal contractor. As such, to protect its employees' health and safety and comply with customer requirements, Agile Defense may require employees in certain positions to be fully vaccinated against COVID-19. Vaccination requirements will depend on the status of the federal contractor mandate and customer site requirements.* **Equal Opportunity Employer/Protected Veterans/Individuals with Disabilities**
